author: Doug in Madison
title: Super value, no 10's here but solid high scores for such an inexpensive set of headphones
content: They feel comfortable on my big ole head, Ear cups seal out other noise about 70% ish and are pretty decent of the soft and comfy scale, sound is plenty good and plug in easily with the 3.5mm std. jack. I highly recommend these for listening on the computed for meetings, youtube videos and as and ebook listener. I have had $600 anr aircraft headsets and these ain't those !! but they are fabulous for the $17 I paid. Very happy. i bought off of the reviews averaging 4.0 and it was a good metric. I give them a 5 while considering the price point.

author: Cat Lady
title: Quality is Good. Price is Right.
content:
These headphones are pretty much exactly what I needed for listening to music while I work. The price was right, and the quality and sound are good. The cord is a tiny bit shorter than my previous headphones, but then, the old ones only got mono sound when they worked and are now totally broken, so these are a vast improvement. ;)

I would have given these 5 stars except that I find they're just a tiny bit too big and don't quite sit on my head properly. I've never experienced that problem before, so it seems that these might be made a tiny bit larger than standard headphones. It doesn't affect listening ability since the tension holds the ear pieces in place, but it's worth noting. They are adjustable, but I have them positioned as small as they will go. They do get larger as well

author: Braunsky
title: Good travel headphones
content: Sound quality is good, but not as clear as no name headphones of similar price from Target.  My hearing is weak on treble, however, so don't be swayed by this part of my review.  In a noisy environment such as an airplane, however, you need clear treble.  Ear cushions are quite small.  Fits tightly against the ears.  Not sure how comfortable they will be over an hour or two.  Folds up as shown, so will be nice for travel.  If you are bald, as I am, you will need to apply some mole skin or similar padding to the head band.  The hinge where it folds digs into my unprotected noggin.

author: Dr. Matt
title: Pretty good sound - Great price!
content:
I must say that these are pretty good for the money. They are NOT as good as the Sennheiser 100's they are replacing, but for a cost that is 10% of those, these are just fine for the gym. They are perfectly acceptable for working out, but a few things I noticed are as folows:
1. Not as loud as Senneheiser - these just barely get loud enough on quiet songs for my iPod Nano
2. Not as comfortable - these are not uncomfortable (everyones head is different - right?), but feel a little harder on the ears and the head band is scratchy when you put around your neck.
3. These are brighter (less warmth and bass response) , but sound is pretty accurate overall and tweaking the EQ helps some.

Overall, these are a great deal for active people who need a cheap set of headphones. I would not give it 4 stars if it was more expensive, but value is part of the equation here. I still have my nice headphones for use at home, but I spent less than $5 on these, so very happy overall!

author: mike
title: Great buy for the price, don't expect anything amazing.
content:
For less than $5, these headphones are very good quality. They're very light and produce clear sounds. However as you can probably guess from the size, they won't go as high a volume without distortion or give you much bass. I bought these because during summer wearing my over-the-ear headphones can get a little stuffy on the computer and I wanted light headphones that feel like I'm not wearing them.

So far these feel great and light enough that I almost feel like I'm not wearing any headphones. Also, they have not caused any discomfort to my ears after 5 hours of constant use. They stay on the ears very well and will not fall off even when I shake my head hard.

I give 4/5 for comfort. I feel the cushion on these headphones should be a little thicker on the edges because the plastic edges can be felt on the ears and is not as comfortable as I'd like it.

Also the sound gets 4/5 because it's easily distorted with high volume, volume doesn't go high enough in some applications, and although the bass is present, it's weak.

author: Dani v
title: Great Headphones, Great Price
content:
These headphones were purchased as a replacement for old Sony, over-the-head, over-ear headphones.  I prefer this style of headphone for running, where earbuds often work their way out (via movement, sweat, or both) and become terribly uncomfortable.  Because Sony discontinued their headphones, I have been looking for equivalent, inexpensive headphones for running.
I have previously purchased various other brand headphones to try to find a replacement, but none were comparable. Some had terrible (and quiet) sound, some had uncomfortable bands, some broke, some had poor cords ("straight" plugs vs 90 degree angle, single cords that swung to one side, long cords that dragged the ground due to length, etc.).

FINALLY, found a great replacement.  These headphones have the best sound of any of the 8+ headphones I've tried in the past...and not just passable sound, but GOOD sound.  Also, they are rugged and good fitting with a solid, but not tight band.  The 90 degree plug-in end is preferred, and the cord is not too long or too short (probably about 40 inches or so).  To top it off, they are very inexpensive.

I highly recommend these for their price!

author: NS
title: Great headphones to use at work.
content:
I use these headphones at my desk at work.
I find them effective for listening to music and radio talk shows.
They are light and very comfortable, so sometimes I forget that I even have them on.
What I find most useful is that I can still hear some of my surrounding environment at appropriate volume levels, so that I can respond if someone is trying to ask me a question.
Also, at such a low price, I don't have to worry if I need to replace them every so often.

author: K. Reese
title: What A Surprise!!
content: We have a full size, weighted key, Yamaha Digital Piano in the house... our son practices a lot and needs phones at times. I read the reviews and took a chance on these, mainly based on the impedence.  I have 3 sets of AKG  K240's,  2 pairs of $150 Audio Technica ATH M50X, and a$300 pair of ATH M70x in my pro recording studio.  This little set of Panasonic 's do a better job thaa all of them for the piano.  Very accurate, flat even frequency spectrum...top to bottom, muscular low mids where so many phones go soft and scoop out the tone.  I put them on while he played and told him to turn the speakers off...they were off.  They sounded so big and the stereo separation was so ambient I thought the room speakers were still blasting away.... but it was just these headphones.  Pretty amazing.  The comparable priced Sony and Koss name brand phones didn't come close.  I don't see how anyone could beat these for the price. A+++++

author: Prince Jacob
title: Great price, some cheap plastic, but will still last you a long time
content:
For the price, I have to admit these headphones are great. Technically, I'd give this 6 stars and then drop a star so that's how it's at 5. :P haha

First off, I'd like to say that I'm not the average user. I'm pretty knowledgeable with tech and I'm also big on keeping devices for a long time. I think it's a rather poor decision to spend more than 10 bucks on headphones or earpieces if they end up getting damaged after a few months. I like to spend less money but also get the most time out of anything I get. I've had earphones for 4 years before. This lasted me 2 years.

They've lasted me a long time but sadly, I can't use them anymore. It's not because the wiring was bad or anything. Unlike most headphones, these hold up very well with the wiring and I never had an issue where my left side stopped working or anything. It's well made wiring and never even worried about it getting damaged.

In fact, the only reason why I can't use them anymore is because the plastic above each earpiece broke. I've tried to fix it with super glue and at one point, only one was broken so I had used a rubber band as a form of a string. (I figured it'd allow to stretch more and plus, I use this mostly in my room and not outside. I did use this a lot for when I traveled on the plane however.) After a while, I was content, but then the other side also broke. At this point, it was just extremely frustrating and disappointing. But, for the fact that I've had these headphones for 2 years, I figured it was fine. Spending less than 15 dollars for something that helped me for 2 years was great.

Definitely worth the price and your time. You'll be glad.

author: Bella
title: Wow.... better sound quality than my $100 headset!
content:
Wow, I was looking for a "normal" pair of headphones which is actually very hard. I didn't want earbuds as they hurt my ears, I didn't want a microphone, I didn't need noise canceling etc. etc. etc... I just wanted something that I could use with my laptop when I'm listening to music and watching a movie. Long story short these are AMAZING! I have a headset that I use for gaming and believe it or not I think the sound quality is better on these "cheap" headphones!

Pros:
-Comfortable! I can't tell you how much earbuds and other headphones hurt my ears. These are actually comfortable!
-Sound quality. OMG! I am listening to music right now with these and I feel like I'm right there at the concert.
-Lightweight. They are so light it doesn't feel like I'm wearing anything on my head.
-Price. You can't get this great quality for this low of a price from anywhere else.

Cons:
-NONE. I don't have any cons personally and have thoroughly enjoyed this product so far.

I give it 5 out of 5 stars because it's an amazing product that was super cheap and does everything that I want.

I recommend these headphones to anyone who's fed up of buying expensive headphones but want good quality. I also recommend this to anyone that has had any neck problems from previous headphones as these are super light and you will forget that they are on your head in you aren't listening to anything. THESE ARE THE HEADPHONES YOU ARE LOOKING FOR!

author: DawnStorm
title: Great sound and fit!
content: These are really nice headphones! They fit well and the ear parts give a bit. I got these so I can listen to music at work; I like that I can listen to my music but but still be aware of someone calling me. You don't have to crank up the volume, which is great not only for health reasons but also general awareness.

author: Ed
title: What you'd expect
content: I needed some working headphones for my computer at work and these did the trick. My computer is stuck under my desk and the cord on these headphones are a nice comfortable length. The fit is fairly nice as well. The sound quality is what you could expect from headphones this cheap.

author: Don  B.
title: Not bad, not great....but...not bad sound, fit, but a bang-on price.
content:
Considering the next-to-nothing price I paid for these little plastic ear-cans I'd call them a good deal. I bought these because I'd heard rumors that Panasonic makes good, and CHEAP, headphones. If these cans are any indication those rumors are true. Their sound, especially considering the price, while not perfect by any means is quite good. And the comfort factor is also good, at least for my head. The ear pads appear to be easy to replace, but the cord is not. But who cares, because for the money a new pair of headphones can be bought. So if your pet lynx chews the cord off, or you neighbor's anteater eats the ear pads you can just buy a new pair of these headphones instead of fiddling around replacing parts. So, the little Panasonics get five stars from me because their price to performance ratio is spot-on, unlike some very expensive, and underwhelming headphones which I've run into.
Would I buy the headphones again? You bet you anteater I would.

author: Nancy Munroe
title: What a steal of a deal.
content: I am so pleased with these headphones. I purchased them in Amazon Prime day for under $7. Exactly what I wanted. I will use them to watch movies on my iPad. I tried them with my iPad and the sound is phenomenal for the price and their size. I wish I had purchased more than one pair!  Word of caution though. These headphones wouldn't work with my iPhone 6 Plus.

author: SLP
title: Simple can be good
content: I like using these simple and lightweight headsets when I am on my treadmill or desk and I want something very lightweight and comfortable that does not encase my ears. I leave that type of headset when I play Fortnite :)). I have another headset with a microphone when I did videos online (don't use them anymore). But I use these lightweight headsets everyday and since they are so cheap I do not worry about damaging them. I do treat them with care since I do like them a lot and I am afraid they may be discontinued and I will not be able to find such a cute pair of headsets. Glad I purchased.

author: WIlliam
title: A Classic never dies...
content:
Style and kind so popular back in the 90's, and now they're the best seller on amazon... Wonder why? read further...

My experience with these have been absolutely amazing!
The sound is incredibly balanced, highs aren't piercing, the bass isn't over emphasized nor does it feel under powered, and the mids just fit right in!
Personally for me, I thought the bass was damn impressive for these headphones!

These are so cheap in price, yet sound so great!? Personally, i wasn't expecting such good sound quality from cheap headphones,
but I am absolutely stunned and will say that these are entirely worth it!

If you're someone who needs something simple, great sounding yet does a great job and not expensive... I recommend these whole hardheartedly!
These feel light and build quality is good. No creaking from the plastics when turning your head or putting the headphones on.

Keep in mind though - These will sound quiet when connected to your phone, the computer does a far better job or even a receiver with amplifying it properly.
You can always consider buying or using software based amplifier on your PC or use a hardware based instead, as these do need some power input in order to produce a louder sound.

Overall - Totally Worth it!!!

author: Buyer
title: Good
content: For the price it’s pretty good. Works well for voice/talking very well actually. Of course you have to be careful with the plastic part as it could break but if you’re looking for something cheap and easy this work. The foam for the ears is not really that soft and there is almost no noise cancellation.

author: Randy Manar
title: Jury is still out. Need to be louder for sure.
content: I like them much better than earbuds,but they need to be louder. I bought them for the gym and I don't know if their connectors are worn out or if these or just poor quality. If your still they seem fine,  but that is not the case at the gym. Will give an update on a few weeks. The are a little louder with my IPod shuffle and much worse on my Amazon fire 7 . If Wal-Mart's website didn't  suck so bad I'd dump slamazon.

author: MJ
title: An amazing set of cheap earphones
content:
After having owned and used these for over a week (35+ hours), here are my thoughts. These are not professional or studio-grade headphones, so I'm primarily reviewing them against others in their price class.

Bass: 5/5 - These headphones have terrific bass, some of the best bass I have heard in this form factor, nevermind at this price range.

Mid-range: 4.5/5 - The mid-range tones seem a touch on the soft side, though this may be partly due to the outstanding bass, I find myself raising the equalizer slightly in these ranges.

High: 4.5/5 - The upper range is smooth and completely lacking the tinny sound expected from cheap headphones. I did notice a VERY slight buzz at loud volumes when listening to a couple of extremely (extremely) high notes. Not enough or often enough to be a problem, it only affects certain pitches (I have had two different soprano singers trigger it), and even then is hardly noticeable 90% of the time, unless you are listening at a very high volume.

Construction: 5/5 - They are fairly sturdy and have survived several drops already with no discernible damage to sound quality. The rotating axles that attache the earpieces to the overhead band have noticably different tolerances, as one earpiece tilts freely, while the other grips the earpiece more firmly, but that is a minor inconsistency and does not cause any discomfort.

Leakage: 5/5 - These headphones have very little sound leakage. Sitting less than 3 feet away, they are entirely inaudible through quite high volumes.

Overall: 5/5

These are definitely the best headphones I have ever used in this price range, hands down.

author: Wendy
title: Too Quiet
content: We bought these headphones, trusting the Panasonic name and the great reviews but are very disappointed. We bought these to replace another, nicer set of Panasonic headphones that had stopped working on one side. Our boys use them for the long car rides we often have during summer and holiday travel but they used them for the first time the other day and they were so quiet they couldn't hear over the noise of the car which wasn't loud. I thought the kids had some settings messed up in their tablets or there was some hidden volume control on the headphones that would fix the problem but I was wrong... they're just wicked quiet! Unfortunately, at this price, it isn't even worth the hassle to send them back.

author: Michael L.
title: Incredibly good for the price.
content: This is the third pair of these I have owned. For their ridiculously low price, these headphones have remarkably good sound, and the music doesn't bleed out. I use them on commuter train rides and nobody else ever hears the music I'm listening to. I throw them in my napsack and, after a year or two, I invariably damage a wire, hence my repurchase. But again, at that price, I'm getting a ton of milage out of them.

author: Meniscus
title: Not your father's Panasonic...
content:
Pros: lightweight, foldable.
Cons: Dollar store sound quality, hinge in center of headband is uncomfortable.
Unlike most headphones which tend to be pronounced in the 1k-2k range, these are VERY pronounced in the 250Hz-800Hz range, very muffled and boomy, I had to slam my 500Hz EQ slider all the way to the bottom and crank the highs to get these to sound normal--my EQ curve looks like a big checkmark.

I have an older Panasonic set that sounds pretty good but has an obnoxious 20' cord that makes them completely useless for any application other than listening at home (WTF were they thinking?!) so I was hoping these would be suitable for office and out-and-about use, but I just can't deal with the sound quality. On anything without an EQ these would be absolutely unlistenable for me.

author: Ilene Jones
title: Great sound and a great price
content: I buy these for my father who uses them all day long.  About 2 years ago I bought him his first pair.  He's been hospitalized for several years and can't move.  He is also hard of hearing, which makes turning a volume way up in a hospital hard to do.  He says the sound is very clear.  The only reason I had to buy a second pair was because how dirty they got in the hospital but the sound and actually equipment was still great.  Would highly recommend.

author: Trickyfireman
title: Like a cheap knock-off.  ....but way worse.
content: For a name brand item, this is total junk.  The sound quality was poor from the beginning, as was the noise isolation, but it was functional for use with my laptop.  THEN, after only a few uses - the tip of the 3.5mm jack broke off in my computer, getting stuck inside the female jack.  Now I have no speakers and no headphone use on a $1000 computer!  It may not be repairable.  ....Stay away from this item!

author: Daniel Castimore
title: Not great quality
content: These are "over the ear" headphones which I'm used to meaning that they block out some of the surrounding noise. These sound like speakers a few inches away from my ears. There is no bass, and you can hear all of the surrounding noise. You get what you pay for I guess, but I had hoped for more.

author: J. Helgeson
title: A (really) poor man's PortaPro
content:
Yeah, I said it.  These sound an awful lot like the Koss PortaPro, for about a sixth of the price (and the PortaPro is cheap as it is!).  I've A-B'ed them, and the bass is *almost* on par.  Seriously.  The big difference in sound signature lies in the mids.  I think these have more pronounced mids.  They seem a smidge more fatiguing to listen to in general, but nowhere near enough to be concerned.

Fit might be objectionable for some--they're super-light, but the drivers are actually tilted *backward* slightly, such that the clamping force of the phones presses only against the area in *front* of your ear--not really *on* the ear itself.  The drivers definitely rest over your ear, but the "on-ear" pressure is negligible.  The only pressure at all is closer to your temples.  Personally, I love this design, because it shifts any pressure to a nice, flat bony area (at least on my head), rather than into my ear cartilage.  But I could see some finding the fit to be strange.

So no, they don't fold flat like the Coby CV185, or clip into a cool ball like a PortaPro, and no, they're not quite as comfortable as a KTX1Pro, but then, what is?  (I have a very tall head, and I think the KTX1s are just about the most comfortable set of cans under $100, but that's just me.)  These cans' back-to-basics design is outright refreshing.  So, of the three (the Coby, the PortaPro, and the KTX1Pro), I have to give these the nod for street wear.

Oh, and did ya notice that they're RIDICULOUSLY cheap?  For the price of a swanky cup of coffee, there's not much to lose.  If you really have money to burn, try the RP-HT46(?), which is the same as these, only there's a volume control (I think), and they FOLD!  But if you're just skatin' on the seriously cheap, yeah, these are them.

author: ReconScout
title: Decent for Low Cost Alternative
content:
I was looking to purchase a few low cost headphones for computer use in my house with 2 children.  I chose the over the ear type instead of buds because we were losing buds at the rate of 2 or 3 a week (seriously) between our house and our mini-van A/V setup. I figured over the ear headphones would be harder to lose for the kids and easier for me to find since 1) they were bigger and 2) the kids did not want to be seen outside the house with these :-). Also, losing headphones at this price point versus $20 ear buds is a little more tolerable.

Simply stated, for the price point, they cannot be beat.  Build quality was not bad at all and I would classify them as durable.  In fact, on the two sets I purchased, I found it to be better than expected. In terms of design, I think the best word to describe it could be: utilitarian.  The headphones are very light weight. We found the cord more than long enough to plug into the headphone port of our monitors or laptops.  BUT, if you need to run the cord a long length, like to the back to a CPU under the desk, you will need a simple extension such as Stereo Headphone Extension 12 feet 3.5mm.  The over the ear padding was more than sufficient for its purpose in my opinion. However, other reviewers have remarked otherwise. The headphones are adjustable enough that they fit a wide range of heads in my house from mine, to both my 6 and 12 year old.

Sound quality is OK.  That's about it. However, that was all I was looking for.  For serious sound, my children and I rely on better quality ear buds anywhere from the $8 to $35 range.

For the right purpose, you will not be disappointed in these headphones.

author: Robert A. Baker
title: The worst sounding name brand headphones ever...
content: Let me preface this review by stating that I'm half deaf.  Only my right ear works, so I usually don't go too expensive on headphones because it'd be light buying Air Jordans if you only have one foot.  That said, this is the worst sounding set of name brand headphones I've ever heard.  I get that they're only $16, but if you're going to make such a bad product, why bother producing it at all, because it really just hurts your brand.  Anyways, there was no bass...NONE.  I usually don't care for thumpy bass with my music, but there has to be something there on the lower end.  Unfortunately, the high end didn't fare any better.  You pretty much end up with headphones that only do mid-range sound, which by itself, is pretty awful.

author: ras4ecs
title: I am very impressed with the bass response of these headphones...
content: These are great! I am very impressed with the sound of these headphones, especially the bass response. For a lightweight, inexpensive pair they really sound terrific compared to all the other cheapies I've bought over the years. I use them for podcasts on the treadmill and tv when my wife's asleep but, they sound good for music as well. The plastic headband may not work well for bigheads (despite what my wife says, I do NOT have a big head!). I wear a 7 1/2 hat and they are perfect without even extending the ear pads. It doesn't seem flimsy at all though so they will probably endure a little stretching without snapping. The pads are pretty comfortable on the ears and the swivel is a good feature. I will buy more of these in the near future.

author: Christopher L. Barber
title: I guess it's what you would expect for a $15 headphone
content: Not quite over the ear; still kind of sits on top of the ear. Headband is hard plastic with no padding and the tension is too high. These are not comfortable at all as compared to, for example, Avantree Audition (still my favorite - best fit and best sound). The sound quality of these headphones is probably fundamentally better than they sound in practice because they don't fit properly and this results in loss of sound energy, especially in lower frequencies. I certainly wouldn't buy these again but I'll keep them as a spare. I just ordered another Avantree Audition. Forget this, just spend the $40 on the Avantree and don't look back.

author: Mr Fancypants
title: Great for pedestrians!
content: Great headphones for walking.  These do NOT block out outside sound which is great for pedestrians.  I can hear traffic, voices, footsteps, barking dogs and even cyclists (hey bicycle riders its called a sideWALK not a sideCYCLE, use the road!).  Anyway, the sound is pretty darned good, not amazing, but very good.  Decent bass, good clarity over all and they can get pretty loud when you want to rock out.  But back to the walking, jogging, etc - they're lightweight and stay on your head pretty well and are very comfortable.  I've given these pretty good abuse picking them up by the cord, accidentally pulling or tugging the cord and I've had no issues with sound dropping out.  Recommended.

author: CasualTech
title: Don't judge a product by its price
content:
Thinking about it, I probably would have been more comfortable with this purchase if this product was 2-4x more expensive, just because it would have made the glowing reviews of it more believable. When you see awesome reviews of a $5 product, you have to wonder, "Is this product truly awesome or is it just awesome for a $5 product?"

Well, in my opinion, this product is truly awesome, made awesomer by its price. I don't think I've ever had headphones of this quality before. I think the sound quality is even better than that of my 2.1 speaker set, subwoofer and all (though granted, it was a fairly cheap set itself, but still sounded great!). I've never had very expensive headphones, but these are even cheaper than all of the ones I've owned previously and yet these own all of them, hands down.

My only lament is that these aren't in-ear earbuds or at least noise-isolating in some way, but that's just not what this product is. That'd be like complaining that a really tasty chocolate ice cream isn't vanilla; I ordered chocolate knowing and expecting it to be chocolate, and even if I prefer vanilla and wish that that amazing ice cream came in that flavor, that shouldn't change my review of that chocolate ice cream.

Anyway, I obviously highly recommend these. ^_^

author: Pen Name
title: Terrible Sound Quality
content: Panasonic makes earbuds that sell on Amazon for under USD$10 and those earbuds have far better sound quality than the RP-HT161-K. I'm not even remotely an audiophile but these headphones make stereo sound like mono. Usually when my iPad is at full volume, I have to turn it down or my eardrums hurt, but not with these. The max volume on these headphones is like the middle range on other headphones, including those earbuds I mentioned. It's like if Nigel, the lead guitarist from Spinal Tap, had gotten these headphones for the band, instead of saying "Well, ours goes to 11," he would have said, "Well, ours goes to 6." On the plus side, they are pretty comfy...

author: Athena
title: Best price, great quality.
content:
This review will probably contradict on my other review regarding price and quality. This is definitely an exception of the saying "you get what you paid for". I paid less than $8 for this headset and I swear it's the best headset I own compared to my expensive ones.

First it is very light, not tight and not lose. Just perfect for me. It is also adjustable but it's perfect for me as is, I don't need to adjust the height.

It is very comfortable and I can use it all day without any problem.

Sound quality is great. Comparable to high end headsets.

The cable is just enough length and you can really enjoy this piece!

Will buy more of this for my kids' school!

author: jnaki
title: an outstanding pair of quality sounding headphones
content:
hello,
  this over the ear pad headphone set is perfect.  no more in the canal irritations and possible drops/fall outs.  these on the ear pads are very soft and transmit the music perfectly.  they are super lightweight, the sound is fabulous.  if necessary to prevent a crease in your hair, the arch can be moved to circle the back of the head and still get quality sounds.  they also squash down to a smaller size for storage.  panasonic comes through again.  no more ear canal irritations or those 60's/70's sound cups over the whole ear.  an outstanding pair of quality sounding headphones

author: C B
title: Great set of basic headphones
content: My dad needed a pair of headphones  that allowed air to get in and out of his ear canals so he didn't get infections. The pair that came with his external amplifier didn't last that long. So, we got these as a replacement. They are so inexpensive that even if they don't last a long time, we can order multiple sets for the price of a replacement of the original pair. The sound is good for the price, and the unit is reasonably comfortable for consecutive hours of wear.

author: Becki
title: Cheap price, Quality Sound
content:
Ordered three of these when they were under $4.  Was just looking for cheap headphones because I work in an environment where the wires may get caught on something and break or the headphones.  Don't want to waste money on something that could be broken on the first day.  3 months later, I am still wearing the first pair.  Still holding up.

The noise levels where I work with running machinery can get a little loud.  I need on the ear versus over or in the ear so I can still hear what is going on.  I know it has more to do with the sound output with the device I listen to, but it is just loud enough that I can still hear the music and what is going on around me.  In a quite environment, the sound is superb.  I can hear nuances in my music that I never heard before, even with the earbuds.  It is really a quality sound that I didn't not expect (nor did I really need) from an inexpensive pair of headphones.

The foam over the speakers is thin, but have held up quite nicely after absorbing sweat.  I thought they would have started to deteriorate already, but they have not.

In short, when these eventually get destroyed, I will definitely buy more, even if the prices jumps up to $10.

author: R. Howell
title: Lightweight materials, decent sound - - worth their price, but nothing more.
content: Picked these up for under a ten spot recently, and they are decent-sounding headphones for sure.  BUT, the materials used to construct them (apparently cheap styrene plastic, brittle and thin) is pretty scary.  I can easily imagine one good drop to the floor will finish them, and the chord is just tiny-gauge and probably won't last long, either.  In all honesty, I just bought them to use at my computer, and maybe to plug into my keyboard to practice without disturbing the rest of the family.  Makes my piano sound rich and full, and that kind of surprised me.  But, to be honest, this is a great example of getting what you pay for.  There is no padding whatsoever on the headband and after a few minutes it begins to cause some pain on the top of my head, and the ear pads just sit on top of your ears (do on cover them) which also becomes most uncomfortable to me in a short while.  I have learned to adjust them upward a bit to alleviate the discomfort.  In the end, this just solidifies my love/hate relationship with Panasonic - - sometimes great quality, sometimes not.  I would not recommend these headphones for anything other than light use at your desk, and hope you have carpet on your floor in case they take a tumble.

author: CEdward
title: There must be better budget choices
content:
We truly aren't talking about a whole bunch of money but just the same I thought a concise review was in order.
Plug them in sound comes out.
Beyond that nothing to be doing cartwheels over, but what do you expect for $5 - $10 ??
Simply looking for simple over ears with which to drift off with..
Difficult to adjust to comfort, ear pads lack degree of adjustment I had hoped for.
Too, when looking at such as these avoid the dual lead-in of wires.
Personal experience suggests they impose an annoying tangle issue and offer no advantage.
Bottom line is should you be thinking of snooze companions keep moving..
Too uncomfortable even for pocket change ....

author: BEP
title: How are these the #1 selling lightweight headphone on Amazon?
content: I bought these to replace a pair of vintage Sony headphones when the connector broke, and I'm not impressed at all. First, the headband is too big for me, and, even on the shortest setting, the earphones won't sit on my ears.  I'm an average-sized adult and have never had this problem in 20 years of wearing lightweight headphones.  Second, even when I hike the phones right up onto my ears, the sound isn't great compared to the Sony headphones.  It's fine, but nowhere near as good.  I guess for such a low price, I shouldn't be disappointed, but I don't think these are going to work for me.  Off to find a pair of vintage Sonys somewhere...

author: Jesus R
title: These lite headphones pack a punch for the money
content:
These headphones really pack a punch  for the price! Its hard to find good on-ear headphones these days without looking you've got cans coming out of your ears. I wear hearing aids, and a lot of the time the cups on a lot of headphones, even more so with cheep headphones, make my hearing aids give feedback. With on-ear headphones this is not the case and I can mostly wear them on top of my hearing aids or pull them to in front of below my ears and still hear them. I can also hear conversations going on around me, and no one has to shout at me to get my attenion.
After reading a lot of the reviews of these headphones, I ordered them. They are lite, and the headband is nice and big. I can see them giving some trouble with someone with a smaller head, but for the most part this shouldn't have a problem. The padding is also nice. It doesn't feel scrachy to the hand, and more importently to the ears. You could easily wear these headphones for hours while doing some work on the computer, or while listenning to some audio around the house. The cord is nice and long so you could step away from a tablet or a computer or stuff the extra cord into your pocket along with your phone if you're moving around.
The sound for these headphones is great. You get a lot of the highs, a lot of the lows, and surprisingly a lot of bass. I'm no audiofile, but I couldn't be happier with these headphones. For such lite headphones the sound is great! If you're not expecting a great sound for 50+ headphones, these headphones I'd say sound anywhere from $10 to $30. If you know the limitiations of these headphones and don't expect them to sound like a $100+ pare of cans, you'll be surprised at how well these little guys sound.
I wouldn't use these at an office, unless its your home office though, on-ear headphones tend to leek a lot of sound. If you don't like or want to use earbuds, and don't want to look like you've got two cans on the sides of your head, these headphones fit the bill. This is one set of headphones I'll be buying again.

author: Karin
title: Actually awesome quality considering the low price, better than a lot of $30+ headphones I've had
content:
I thought these would be crappy quality because of how cheap they are, but I was pleasantly surprised!
Pros:
- Really amazing quality, great bass, love them!
- On-ear so your ears don't hurt even after using them for 3+ hours
- I use this for gaming since noise-cancelling ones make it hard to talk to other people (when playing together in the same room we still use headphones so the game sounds don't play from each person's computer)
- Easy to use and hassle free

Cons:
- None that I've experienced

author: Go Dawgs
title: Let in too much noise
content: Wanted to use these a while before writing a review.  What they do ok is provide good sound and comfort for your ears at a cheap price.  I use exclusively for watching movies on laptop.  What they don't do and I thought they did is noise cancellation to a point, certainly I didn't expect Bose level.  If you're the only one in the house and control noise around you no problem.  If my wife is watching TV in same room, they let in far too much noise.  The ear bud type headphones do a much better job of blocking noise.  Not sure I would purchase again, but can't argue with the price.

author: F. Bradley
title: Waste of time
content: Don't bother. If you have a smartphone with a case on it, and buy these, the jack won't even fit all the way through the hole so you can plug them into your phone snugly. In other words, the headphones won't fit in the jack and keep popping out. Waste of time, money.

author: Bruce P.
title: Great basic headphones.
content: I can see why so many people have given these little headphones such high ratings. Terrific sound quality, durable materials, and great price point. What is really nice is that you do not have to stick them into your ears to get good fidelity. Very impressed overall. It seems these days that some of the old standards in the electronics industry have gone downhill in quality. Not Panasonic.

author: Jeffrey B.
title: Best for the price!
content: These headphones are great for all general applications.  I wear them for exercise, at the computer, and for occasional gaming sessions.  Very good sound quality and VERY comfortable.  My biggest problem is I forget they are on and walk away pulling my laptop with me!  For the price, you won't be disappointed.

author: 9ine
title: the perfect on the go head set with all the sound you need
content: WoOoOoW the panasonic RP-HT227 monitor headset yes Extra Bass itz on! with these the perfect carry on, ipods explods with sound. my Htc is on 10!! with these they Rock for "real" for the price i was like!! dizammm they are the truth i was blown away with the balance of sound they produce with EQ or not!! i have also purchased the JVC RX 300 monitors along with these and i got the best "deal" ever on the pair. my panasonics are my carry withs, and my jvc's are my at home's hphones these panasonics are the meaning of sound and with a fair price and for the sound im very, very, very,impressed with the block of outside noise keeps you rocking on im like i can hear sounds in drake i did'nt hear befor so for your hiphop, rap, rock, classical,and other music you will not be let down i was going to buy some bose or some  Dr dre beat's but i have compaired to these manufactures of bose& Dr dre beats they all have "great" sound but i had to choose panasonic for the sound and for the 28mm drivers for the size plus the price. you can't lose with these babys. sound very's on some devices but but if you have EQ app's on yr ipad or HTc or androids you will get the maximun sound out of these baby's they can handle it if you know your oms&sound balance.Panasonic RP-HT227 Monitor Headphones with XBS® Extra Bass System these are 28mm drivers so dont crank if you dont thank!!know your sound levels for all your sound products and they will last a lot longer...as for these babys the extras are in it.Panasonic RP-HT227 Monitor Headphones with XBS® Extra Bass System

author: Damien R.
title: Very good sound quality for price.
content:
For the price, these are absolutely phenomenal.  The sound quality is pretty much as good as I really need for enjoying music, and I usually consider myself *fairly* picky about that.  They do leak very badly though, if that's a concern for you (i.e. others may hear your music if it's very loud).
They do get a bit uncomfortable if you wear them for over a couple hours, because they put a bit of pressure on the ear; but maybe that's just me.
My one complaint is that recently the adjustable notches on the right side went loose on mine, so it slides up and down when I take them off; but they still stay in place just fine when I'm wearing them.  But I've had these for almost two years before that happened, using them almost every day.

author: Chris A. Kantack
title: Durable, high quality, great sound, and very inexpensive!!! - What more do you want?
content: For the money, you cannot buy better headphones than these.  I'm so impressed with them that I have bought them as gifts for others too.  I have had these headphones for a few years.  The very first pair I highly abused.  Wore them for hours and hours on end while doing yard work and after 18 months or so of daily use I broke them.  But since they held up so well I bought a replacement pair for the home and another for the office.  No problems even though they still get occasionally abused by my frequent use.  If there is any downside to these headphones, I'd say they could be just a tad more comfortable.  But I could say that about all headphones.

author: Janie
title: Very good product
content:
This is a long belated review, but it was on my list of Amazon un-completed reviews.

I wanted to say I use these frequently to hear my laptop sound louder, and also for my bedroom TV late at night so I don't bother the neighbors with sound.

I do find the cord a little short to reach me in the bedroom, so I bought an extension, but wish I could just use it a little easier without the extension.  Anyway, it's working fine after more than a year.

author: CA
title: Good Quality, Low Price
content: If you want a pair of headphones that you don't have to charge and don't have to worry about losing, yet give you very good quality sound response, these are the ones. No, they don't fold into a 4" x 2" container, but they are just plain good and they don't fatigue your ears like the heavy, expensive, earmuff style headphones do. If you demand audiophile, isolated, noise-cancelling headphones, look elsewhere, otherwise, I'm guessing you will be pleased.

author: Bret
title: Impossibly good sound for the money!
content:
I thought I'd mention how amazing these little headphones are, in case anyone's looking for inexpensive headphones as I was. I had these years ago and had forgotten how surprisingly good they are for the money. I think it's likely that this pair of headphones must be one of the most popular in the world. I've seen them all over the place.
Their sound quality is shocking for such an unassuming product at such a frugal price. Base is fully heard, rich and deep, but not booming or muddy as it can be in some augmented headphones. Treble and midrange are bright and detailed. It's actually hard to believe that such frequency reproduction can come from these tiny little drivers.
What about them explains an eight dollar price? Oh, well, they're very cheap plastic, and I'm sure they'd snap in half very easily. There is no noise cancelling effect whatsoever. They're a bit uncomfortable after some time.
If you're in a pinch or want some wonderful portable headphones to run around with, and are disgusted by ear buds as much as I am, and if you're a well-coordinated adult who can be a bit careful not to break them (ha ha!), I doubt you can do any better than these at such a teeny price. Very happy I got some once again.

author: Pablo
title: Panasonic is Still One of the Best Entry Headphones
content: These are a great set of headphones that don't cost an arm and a leg!  They are NOT Bose, Beats, or other high-end exotic.  These are great for everyday use!  I use them when I transcribe notes, listen to music from my laptop, and watch movies on my table while inflight.  They've got a nice rich sound and fit snug on my head.  You can go wrong for the price and the seller is a pleasure to purchase from!  Shipping/Delivery time was faster than originally scheduled.  I look forward to purchasing another pair in the future.

author: Angela 2584
title: Inexpensive good product
content:
These work well for me.
I just wanted something simple that didn't cost an arm and a leg.  I would recommend if you are looking for an inexpensive pair that works. Much better than store bought brands. Of course these are not the quality of say a 100.00 dollar pair, however I would put them up against a 50.00 dollar pair.

author: SeattlePole
title: Just OK
content:
My favorite in-ear buds died after 3 years and I needed something different. I was tired of stuffing buds into my ears and decided to try these headphones out based on all of the glowing reviews. All I can say is they are just OK.

Pros:
1. Cheap
2. Good sound (bass and treble)
3. Light

Cons:
1. Quiet (need to crank the volume to get sound out)
2. Can easily be overpowered by outside noise in a noisy setting (e.g. public transit bus)
3. Might be too fragile

Overall they sound good but because they are quiet and can get lost in outside noise they don't do me much good.

Would I buy them again? No
Would I recommend them? No

author: Al Cannistraro
title: Great sound over a wide frequency range
content: These are my favorite headphones for utility use, and have been for many years. The wiring at the jack tends to break with a lot of use, so I always have a fresh replacement or two on hand. I love these headphones and very much hope that they will continue to be available.  Note that they are not noise canceling or suitable for active uses. I have other headphones for these purposes. Very comfortable for all-day wearing.

author: AZ123
title: Good Gym Headphones
content: Light, durable, affordable, and good sounding headphones i use while working out at the gym. Our home headphones are much better, but these can take the abuse of a gym bag, travel, etc., without problem. The previous set lasted several years before finally giving up the ghost, which is pretty good for any electronics at this price. I like these because my ears cannot tolerate the earbud-style headphones, and they don't completely shut out the outside world unless you wish to via high source volume. a good product, which is my experience with most items produced by Panasonic.

author: guitaristwife
title: Great headphones for the price!
content: So far, so good.  The headphones are nice and light, sound great, and the cord length is perfect!  I haven't worn them for long periods of time to see if they will hurt my ears, but so far, no discomfort.  They are adjustable and actually don't squeeze my head like others do.  Love that they actually do go over my ears and not touch the ears still!

author: Kent Wright
title: These phones are a good value
content:
These headphones produce excellent sound, particularly when one considers their moderate price. My wife has used a set of these for a couple of years and likes them because they are lightweight and feel comfortable to her. She recently broke the headband, which I was able to repair, so I bought another pair as a backup.

I used a different set of these same phones myself for several months some time ago. I listen to audio on my iPod while I walk laps on an indoor track, and I found the sound to be very pleasing to me. However, it turned out that the foam cushions on the headphones were slightly rough. These pads irritated the skin on my ears just enough after long, heavy, usage that I gave them away and replaced them with EarPods.

I would recommend these headphones to a friend whose ears don't stick out as far as mine do.

author: Nickie
title: The best!
content: These are my absolute favorite headphones I've ever owned! I've bought them multiple times in the past decade or so. I tend to get about 2 to 2 1/2 years out of them (and they get used daily). Highly recommend these to anyone who still enjoys wearing headphones vs earbuds like me.

author: mofo83
title: Okay for the money, but spend a little more and get Koss KTXPRO1
content:
These headphones are fine for the money, but I would definitely suggest that you spend just a little more and get the Koss KTXPRO1 headphones instead.

The Koss phones are MUCH more comfortable (I can't stress this enough) and they also sound better. Trust me, your ears will be glad you spend the extra bucks.

I wear the Koss phones for hours each day at work, and they never hurt. These Panasonics hurt after less than an hour. I think it's because the face of the phones isn't parallel with my ears, so the from edge of the earpieces digs into my upper jaw.

Of course, your head may be different than mine, but I think most users will find the Koss phones more comfortable.

Good luck!

author: izikkL
title: I WOULD RECOMMEND SOMETHING "MORE" DURABLE...
content:
Not the sturdiest headphones, but the sound quality is pretty good. Nice highs and lows.
REVISED REVIEW:
__

I CAME BACK TO BUY A 5TH & 6TH PAIR OF THESE, AND DISCOVERED THAT THE PRICE HAD TRIPLED (30 BUCKS).
SO, I CHANGED MY MIND AND WENT WITH A PAIR OF SKULLCANDY HEADPHONES.

YES, THEY DO SOUND GREAT, BUT THEY BREAK VERY EASILY... SOME PROBLEM WITH ALL FOUR PAIRS (ONE HEADPHONE CUT EVENTUALLY COMES OUT OF IT'S SOCKET, WHICH IS UNREPAIRABLE... THUS RENDERING THEM USELESS!!!

AT THE $10-$12 PRICEPOINT, I WOULD JUST BUY ADDITIONAL PAIRS. BUT, AT $30 A PAIR... I WOULD SERIOUSLY SUGGEST YOU FIND A MUCH MORE DURABLE PAIR!!! - IF NOT... YOU'LL BE REPLACING THEM WITHIN THE YEAR.
__

DROPPED MY PREVIOUS RATING DOWN TO THREE (3) STARS!!!

At this price point, don't expect high-end audio... but they are decent and a great deal for the price.

As I mentioned before... not very durable. I dropped a pair and when it hit the carpeted floor it cracked the left ear piece and it fell off.
Luckily, I had bought two when I ordered them... so I had a backup. I bought a third pair, in case something like that should happen again.

author: Moi Aussi
title: Don't forget the superglue...
content: I was tired of buying $50 headphones only to have the cord snap or suffer some other trauma, since I use my phones outside while I work on trees, etc. So I tried these. First thing I did was apply some superglue to the junction of the cord and the "speaker." This has served me well. Months later, after a lot of abuse, they're still functioning well. The sound is remarkably good--for music or speech. I'm not an audiophile any more, but for the few bucks these cost, you really can't go wrong. But don't forget the superglue: fifty cents will protect your investment.

author: M. godley
title: Lasted 3 years.  Not bad.
content: I bought these headphones 3 years ago and they finally broke.  I was very pleased with them and the price until that happened, but now I'll have to buy some new headphones which will be more sturdy.  I would recommend buying better quality headphones so you don't have to replace them so often.

author: tloppa
title: for under 20 bucks, this is a good cheap headphone
content:
IF you want a pair of decent sounding over the ear headphone that you can carry around without worrying about being damaged etc, this is the headphone for you.  I have a pretty big head and this still fits my head well, without feeling squeezed.  Although the band and the earcups "feel" cheap but they are very durable.  For under 20 bucks, this is the best, comfortable cheap headphone you can buy.

I also have Senheiser HD 569 and SEnheiser HD700, so I"m not just blowing smoke when i say this panasonic headphone is pretty good.  If you don't have the money or just want a good usable over the ear headphone, this one will cover you.  As long as you dont set high expectation for a headphone that is under 20 dollars.

author: J. A. Eyon
title: where's the decibels
content:
this headphone had a short and miserable life - it broke 1 week after i received it - and i was relieved

the first thing i noticed when i put it one was the low decibel level - i turned up the volume on the devices i tested this on - and the sound still sounded muted

the plugin broke when i dropped my tablet - i don't recall that ever happening before

headphones - i hardly knew ye - and won't miss ye either

author: demonsRendangered
title: My spare set
content: Just a spare set of headphones for listening to music when I sleep. Thing about sleeping with headphones on is there's always a chance down the line that the headband will snap, though honestly mine usually last years before I typically replace them due to audio cutting out on one side. These are perfect for my needs since the price is low enough to justify the gamble of sleeping with them on my head.

author: Larry B.
title: Economical with good sound, but...
content: These headphones are lightweight with really good sound. Only problem is that they are fragile. One tiny tug and the wiring separates inside the headphone and then you are down to a left or right speaker. I have bought 4 sets of these headphones over the past 5 years because of the build quality and next year I'll most likely need my 5th set. Yes, I will probably buy them again.

author: Max Perdue
title: Good for approx. 4 months... and then doomsday
content: One star more than pretty much crap. The plastic is as cheap as cheap can get, and while the sound was okay, touching the jack generated a lot of static. It snapped on both sides, and on one side, the adjustments completely broke and it always slipped. (Ironically, on the day I damaged them, my sister broke her earbuds) As someone who just can't use earbuds, this feels like a real letdown. Worked perfectly for about 4 months, and then I screwed them up somehow. Static was common, and at one point, they just didn't work at all. Panasonic, you failed. Buy this at your own risk. And if you do, keep some duck tape at hand in case the adjustments snap.

author: Noah's Ark
title: Amazingly wonderfull full range audio for a cheap $8 headphone. The comfort is the only shortfall.
content:
Though a bit uncomfortable in fit, the sound quality is amazing for the price!

The audio frequency response is balanced and can provide very rich base and clear distinct treble with thorough full mid-range. All harmonic overtones come through well balanced with no booming,

Though the cheap headband makes them initially uncomfortable, they are light and are tolerable for casual short time use in a home studio. Due to cheap design of the head band, the ear pads cannot independently swivel and may not sit properly flush on the ear. But the audio  quality is so good that they still provide excellent listening despite the possible ear pad placement issues.

The 54 inch cord make it well worth buying for home studio use.

author: Julie
title: ONLY WORKS FOR SIX WEEKS
content:
One earphone stopped working at the end of November 2018.  We purchased these on October 18, 2018.  I purchased the Square Trade warranty but they only cover items AFTER the original warranty runs out.  I went to the panasonic website and entered the model number and the system said "We can't find that item."  I give up.

And Amazon shows Panasonic's help desk as open 8am to 8pm EST.  It's actually open 10am to 4pm.  FYI.

author: rockr007
title: Best headphones - exceeds cost - quality comparison
content:
This is the best headphones I have ever owned. I have been using these headphones for more than 4 years. I am currently using my 3rd piece and that's because I sometimes fall asleep while watching movies and end up breaking it!

The sound quality is excellent. I have used the iPhone 4 and iPhone 5 earphones and the Panasonic quality is light years ahead.. Panasonic headphones are super light and that causes zero irritation to the ears.

I have compared sound quality with Sony noise cancellation headphones which cost 80-100$ and believe me, they are worthless. They are heavy, too hard on people with bigger ears and sound quality is no where near the Panasonic.

All in all, this product is a clear winner. My last piece was bought 5 months back and they have same quality as before. Put them on and relax to enjoy wonderful sound quality for really low price.

Last but not the least - don't  get fooled by the low price, because this product is totally worth much more.

author: Wayfinder
title: Good sound, very uncomfortable
content:
These headphones have good sound, especially considering the price.  They're not "pro level" headphones, but they don't carry a $100 price tag either.  The bass is balanced well, not overbearing, not too low.  The sound is rich and vibrant.  Overall fairly pleased on that aspect.  The inline volume control is a nice bonus.

Physically they are very uncomfortable to wear. They're okay on the ears, but the center of the headband folds for transportation/storage... and that center has a ridge that cuts right into the top of your head.

Since I didn't have anything to glue on the inside of the headband to pad them, I returned them for being the most poorly-designed headband on the market.  Surprises me this design made it to the production line.  Definitely needs better comfort-protection on the headband.

author: Courtney
title: Broke too quickly to even review honestly
content: My daughter loved these for a few weeks. The sound was great and Boise cancellation was impressive, but they broke within 3 weeks(not externally, the plug seems to have lost its connection?) Of simple and easy use. Will not buy again. 😭

author: Tammy S Rush
title: Great but lumpy!
content:
Good: Fantastic, cheap headphones. Best cheap phones I have used. I've purchased 2 pairs (one to replace my first) in 5 years - and I'll keep buying them as long as they make 'em (and I break 'em.)

The (not too bad): the joint where the phones fold is a bit irritating to the top of the skull. Nothing a bit of padding won't fix. I used a short piece of self-adhesive weather strip. While Panasonic should have padded the headrest themselves, it's an easy fix for anyone who finds the prominent joint uncomfortable.

author: 🔹 Catrinka 🔹
title: They didn't work well for me...good thing they were cheap
content:
Okay, I realize that these are very inexpensive headphones, but I had hopes for them.

I usually just use typical iPod ear buds for regular use and a couple of brands of over-the-ear headphones for holding in place during running and strenuous workouts.  My plan for these headphones was for using while outside working in the lawn with mowers and other machinery running.  I realized that they wouldn't silence other sounds in the way that the much heavier, fully padded/insulated headphones do...but I had expectations of them being able to deaden outside noises as much or more than regular ear buds.  I was reluctant to wear the heavier headphones that completely surround your ears while outside working since I didn't want to completely tune out what was happening around me.

It didn't take long to come to the conclusion that they offer nothing at all in the way of outside sound reduction.  The in-your-ear buds cover outside noise better than these do.  So, I thought...oh well, I'll just use them for regular indoor listening.  They're certainly comfortable enough.  But, they don't stay on...or at least they don't stay on me.  I have to remain perfectly motionless or else they slide off my ears.

The sound clarity is decent for the price.  The cable is plenty long at about 4.5.'  The XBS port is supposed to offer increased bass response.  I maybe noticed a bit of difference there; but it's of little help when the headphones won't stay in place on my ears.

author: Alex G.
title: It's not comfortable to wear
content:
The plastic piece that goes over your head is very uncomfortable. I had to use padding. The sound is ok, but
you have to push the ear pieces against your head to really hear what you're listening to.. No  volume control.

author: Jesus Lopez
title: Going on 4 years with them.
content:
I purchased these for my wife's classroom. Her students use them all the time. Going on 3 years I believe. I'm going to have to buy another paid like this for my wife's personal use, she goes through 4 pair of earphones a year.
These over the ear headphones are great if your not looking to spend a fortune on headphones. Don't expect amazing sound quality for that you'll have to keep looking. I give these 5 stars because they've lasted a really long time.

author: CharlieOldGuy
title: Comfortable
content:
After nearly a month I am pleased with these. They are comfortable and allow some outside sounds to reach the listener (the Wife) when necessary. Comfortable, even when lying in bed listening to an audible book. The long cord kind of gets in the way (as did a short cord on the old ones) but is worth the very minor annoyance to place the audible reader where I want it.

UPDATE -- Sept. 17, 2018
Bought these in January 2018 and by the end of August stopped working. Out of warranty. They weren't expensive but I only want them for audio books, I'm functionally blind and unable to read print without complicated electronic aids. If these headphones had lasted at the very least a year I would have updated with a 2 or 3 stars. I recently purchased KOSS UR 20 for a few dollars more and I like the fit and look better (also an 8' cord) and I hope they get longer trouble free use.

author: TheGryphon
title: Great Headphones
content: I love these headphones.  They're very comfortable, have great sound quality, and, best of all, they have a cord long enough that I can use them while in bed (my TV/DVD/VCR is at the foot of my bed).  I had been using an extension cord with other headphones, but the quality wasn't nearly as good.  Price, delivery, & product - 5-star all around.

author: Just Me
title: Planned obsolescence is a pain and the sound is only average
content:
Bought 2 pair of these (it never hurts to have a spare) at the end of July 2018 and the first pair just lost sound on the right side (11 December 2018).  I know I only paid $8 for these, but they could at least have lasted more than 6 months instead of barely over 4!

As for sound quality, they're only average.  I bought these for watching TV late at night so I didn't wake anyone else up and they're adequate for that.

If anyone knows of an on ear set of headphones that has good sound, isn't enclosed (my Bose headphones make my ears sweat) and are made to last, please comment and let me know.  :-/

author: ErikWTN
title: Surprisingly good sound!
content: I was a little skeptical because of the low price of these headphones but bought them based on the reviews. I was not disappointed at all. The sound is really very good for such a small inexpensive set of headphones. I work in front of a set of studio monitors that are very accurate and often find myself taking the headphones off to check that the speakers aren't on and annoying my coworkers because I can hardly tell the difference in the sound of the speakers vs the headphones. The only minor complaint is that they are a little uncomfortable (for me) to wear because of the smallish size of the earpads and the fact that they don't sit flat against your ear, they angle in a little too much toward the front so they slightly pinch my ears, but it's not terrible. Everyone's ears/head are different so these may fit others perfectly. Regardless, I'm ordering a backup pair now.

author: Grazillx
title: Not a very good fit
content: Sound quality is fine for the price.  You can't really tell from the picture, but the ear cups do not pivot, which means these are very size specific.  They are a little wide for me so they don't fit flat on my ears.  There is more pressure on the bottom of the cup.  There is enough padding so that the top of my ear is still covered, but they are not very comfortable.  I eventually had to apply some heat from a lighter to bend the top strap to fit right.

author: DiG
title: Not great not bad either
content: Seeing how I have about 50 or so headphones in my lifetime I decided to get these because I had a pair of modified Koss drivers that I needed to be  housed and tore these drivers out to frame the expensively wired Koss titaniums in it. I can say these were the definition of meh. And I have many many cheap heaphones as well as a decent amount of 300 dollar to 700 dollar headphones(no never Beats), like Grados and Beyerdynamics,Shures, etc. These are very plain and don't have  a great range on any of the levels, mids are a but muffled, and bass is so-so not good, highs are a tinge to flat and not crisp. All in all they are fine for 14 dollar headphones, and as portables they are light but the materials are pretty cheap as I got to look at the drivers they look so cheap and non-quality like a magnet stuck to a diisc of plastic. But these are just to hear voices and vocals mostly and not really enjoy every sound.

author: ONeal
title: NOT Over-the-Ear Headphones.  not going to use.
content:
NOT over the ear headphones as listed.  just regular, smash against your ear headphones.  dang it.  i won't use these.  not what i wanted, not what was advertised and not worth the trouble of sending back, so it's a waste of money.  tried them on my head and that was it.  i didn't even bother plugging them in.  these are open to external sounds and i specifically ordered these to help block external sounds while i'm listening.

i don't get many bad deals from amazon, but this was one.

author: Centrafuge
title: Good product with bottom pricing
content:
These headphones deliver a surprising good sound for being one of the cheapest headphone options on Amazon. They are made of breakable plastic, but with normal use, I find they've kept up better than some of my more expensive headphones.
Thanks to their minimalist nature, they conform to a small head really well and don't make me look like a goon with over-sized cans.
The only major con is that like most cheap headphones, the size adjustment part can snag and pull your hair if you're not careful.
I was very pleasantly surprised when I purchased these, and even now with an improved headphone budget, I'm not looking to replace them.

author: josh
title: Great Headphones But Only 90 Day Warranty
content: my 12 year old is permanently connected to her laptop via these RP-HT161 headphones. i've tried a lot of under $20 padded headphones and these are my go to model. very good sound, pretty comfortable, good sound isolation from environment, good jack connection to macbook. they broke after four months which they all do with her so that's not a strike against them. my one disappointment is the warranty: only 90 days. i'm re-buying them, but this time, i will get the extended warranty.

author: Chester
title: I like too look at specifications
content:
When I shop, I like too look at specifications. No where amongst all the questions and reviews is the frequency response, sensitivity, and impedance listed. Here they are frequency response is 16 Hz up to 22 Hz. Look at that figure when you compare headphones. Sensitivity is 100dB/me, and impedance rated at 24 ohms. The impedance is very good rating for small portable electronics such as radios, Ipads and laptop computers, anything larger you would need a rating of >25. The sensitivity of earphones is usually in the range of 80 to 125 dB.
To sum it all up what we have here is an excellent headphone for the price of $5.40 which cannot be duplicated or beat the price anywhere

author: Beavis Comeavis
title: Great value, perfect for more risky situations
content:
The perfect cheapo headphones. I take one to work, keep one upstairs, one downstairs, one in my travel bag, etc. They are great because they work adequately and they are fairly durable, but they cost so little. Eventually the form will wear away, the plastic piece that helps hold them to size will break away, and they'll just become more and more beat up. But they last long enough that they are totally worth it. Each pair seems to last me a couple of years with daily use.  They are perfect for more risky situations where you may have concern your equipment could get banged up or lost, or kids might get a hold of them. If they get smashed, who cares. Buy another. I bought like 4 or 5 of these. Totally worth it for situations where you don't want to take your expensive headphones.

Sound quality is acceptable. If you're an audiophile, then you won't be satisfied with the quality. I use them for video streaming, video games, listening to music, etc and it always seems ok to me. They don't drown out external noise much though, so if you're in a noisy environment, it's not going to work out well.

author: Gregory J. Casteel
title: They're cheap; but they're cheap
content: I've always had a problem with headphones.  They never last very long.  Maybe I just handle them too roughly; but, usually after only a few months of use, they tend to wear out on me.  Most of the time the problem seems to be a short in the cord.  When this happens, I can only hear out of one ear unless I hold the cord juuuuuuust right.  Anyway, I always end up having to replace my headphones at least a couple of times a year, no matter which brand or model I buy; so the cheaper I can get them, the better.  These headphones actually work quite well; and they are inexpensive.  The only drawback is that they wear out on me pretty quickly.  Anyway, it's time for me to replace the ones I bought about six months ago; but I'm going to go with the same model once again, because they're so reasonably priced.  Yeah, I know that this isn't exactly a ringing endorsement; but I've had the same problems with just about every pair of headphones I've ever owned.  These are certainly no worse than any of the others; and at least they're not very expensive to replace.

author: Zach
title: What more could you want for the price?
content:
I bought these to be "at work" headphones so I'll always have a pair on hand at the office. I've had expensive headphones and cheap ones, and while these don't sound as good as more expensive headphones, I don't expect them to. For listening to YouTube videos featuring a lot of dialog, you'll likely need to turn the volume way up. They don't get very loud.

For the price these headphones are awesome. They're very comfortable and don't press very hard into your head. They sound pretty okay. I wouldn't want these as my only pair, but as a secondary set for office work they deliver 100% and have saved me a lot of money.

author: Lourdes L.
title: Really great.
content: Not an audiophile at all, but I like to hear music with a decent quality.  These little fellows are really good in quality of sound.  Bass is not bommy, but is really good (I shall say, beautiful).  Maybe a little lack in highs, but not to say they are not good, because they are really good.  The fit is also a little tricky, but again that is not a big deal.  You will be amazed of how nice they sound for the price.

author: GV Earwood
title: Good basic headphones
content: Really good sound quality and comfort fit, especially for the price. They are not noise cancelling which is what I wanted so I could hear doorbells, knocks, barks, phone, etc. Very good purchase.

author: 2000-VMax
title: They work Great connected to my Asus ROG Strix B450-F MB !!!!
content: These seem to be very good headphones for the price. They provide excellent noise cancellation when I am gaming or listening to music in a noisy room. I have them connected to my Asus ROG Strix B450-F gaming MB's SupremeFX S1220A chipset and the sound quality is Very good. Overall I am Very satisfied with them and would definitely recommend them to anyone looking for a reasonably priced set of headphones to use in a noisy environment.

author: Oldglory
title: The sound was distorted horribly! But since I knew they should work well
content: I had a pair of these for two years.  The pads cover my ears lightly and the head band is extendable so it can fit different size heads.  The pair I had gave out, so I got another pair from Amazon.  That pair did NOT work at all.  The sound was distorted horribly!  But since I knew they should work well, I ordered them again.  This pair now is working as well as my original ones.  I LOVE these headphones.  I do not like to have ear buds in my ear.  These have a comfortable fit.  They also have a long cord so I can easily work while listening to my music at the computer.  I would recommend these!

author: Christopher R. VandenHeuvel
title: so awesome
content:
What can I add? I can say from personal experience that these headphones sound better, last longer, and are more comfortable than models costing two or three times as much. And these other models were still BUDGET headphones (from Sony and Philips if you're curious). To say that these are the best value for your money is to not praise them enough. It's more like they are stuck on a permanent 75% price discount.

Panasonic, please make a version of these that has an elastic cord pull guard, and has maybe a more sporty/athlete look so that I can look cool jogging. Maybe a behind-the-neck style. Everything else can stay exactly the same and I will gladly pay twice as much. Or just keep selling these. Chris gives the Panasonic RP-HT21 5 stars.

author: Davey
title: Best headphones $5 can buy
content: The plastic is flimsy and will likely break if mistreated, but hey, it’s a $5 pair of headphones and that’s what you get. With that being said, the sound is really nice for the price. Yeah it can’t be compared to a $100 pair, but I’m still impressed. All in all, if you take care of them then they are well worth the money

author: Zakrinvegeta
title: Amazed by the sound quality compared to earbuds
content: I did have to wait a God amount of time for these to come in. These headphones mirror the old dishman headphones. They are unbelievably comfortable!! And the sound quality is incredible! The right amount of bass and the right amount of acoustics! These are superior to most of the earbuds I've had. So good, that I've bought a second pair. No squeezing of my skull and no constant pushing back into my ears. I spend every 12 seconds at work pushing earbuds deeper into my ears. But these eliminate that. But the sound cancelling I'd so good that I hahe to temper the volume, which does sacrifice sound quality, to hear sounds around me- like people shouting my name. You can get lost in the ephemeral magick these headphones create. I plan to buy one or two more and keep them on my list just in case.

author: My Dog Loves Me
title: Not So Great
content: These are not big enough to actually fit OVER the ear as claimed.  They sit on the edges of the ear, which becomes painful in about ten seconds.  They work as far as sound quality, but if you are accustomed to the quality of Bose, you will certainly find fault with these.  All the positive reviews must be from people with tiny, tiny ears.

author: JJ
title: Good Value
content: They're lightweight, comfortable, and so far, durable.  So, how about sound quality? They're headphones, after all. Well, for the price, they're good.  If they were to cost much more, I'd skip them.  These are best for your computer or tablet, watching shows or playing games. For music, they're adequate.  But you know what?  Many people can't hear the difference between good and great headphones anyway.  I bought these to keep next to my computer and needed something that would withstand the 'fists of fury' of my little kids.  One of these days, the headphones will lose, but I won't shed a tear over the price I paid (and I'll gladly buy another).

author: JAik
title: Volume Control Not Good Enough
content: Comfortable with good sound, but the volume range is too low for the main use I had in mind, which is a digital audio converter on a TV. With the volume turned all the way up on these, it is still not that loud. A wireless set that I have works fine, so it is not the converter. I am keeping and using them with other devices that have a separate volume control of their own.

author: RayN
title: Basically cheap junk.
content:
I had a pair of these that lasted me over 5 years. Then the ear pads broke down. Bought this pair and right out of the box the jack has a bad connection and you have to jiggle the wire to get sound from it.
Warranty is through Panasonic and NOT through Amazon. I didn't want to deal with Panasonic and have to jump through hoops to get it replaced.
On the plus side, I took off the foam pads and replaced them on my old set. That set still works fine, these went in the trash.

author: Lynnea
title: The jack does not fit properly.
content: I just received this headphone and tried it on my new iPad Pro.  The jack doesn't fit snugly so the sound fades.  I had to jiggle the cord to get the sound.  While the folding part is attractive for traveling., I will not keep this headphone with the sound problem.  I have other  headphones which I have used on the same iPad and they do not have this problem.

author: Truffle Shuffle
title: Completely satisfied.
content:
Panasonic delivers yet again. And whoever's behind the design knows what they're doing and what's in demand, nailed it on this one.

The price makes it a steal pretty much given the brand and the quality it provides. It's rich with enhancing features such as the longer cord that allows for more movement (was a must for me, the short cord problem I had was starting to drive me insane), surprisingly lightweight (than was expected ) which will make longer sessions more comfortable, plush padded ear pads for more comfort. Hell I'll probably fall asleep in them sooner or later with all this comfort lol

Bottom line it's a solid, honest product from a quality brand. What you see is what you get. Can't ask for more than that.

author: Ed
title: You will be shocked at the high quality sound from these headphones!
