content: My expectations were not very high when I ordered these headphones.  We needed something inexpensive for the boys to plug in to the DVD player in back of car.  The reviews on these were great so I put my trust in previous buyers.  Verdict = AWESOME!  I could easily listen to these instead of my more expensive headphones that are bulkier.  The sound is incredible.  Sometimes you get what you pay for, in this case you get 10 times better than what you paid.  Not sure how Panasonic can produce high quality sound at this price point.  Highly recommend!

author: Ariel Domke
title: What a steal
content: I originally purchased these headphones for playing guitar and they are an incredible bargain. You cannot ask more of a $20 pair of headphones. They are quite clear and sound great. They are not the best, but I find it hard to justify purchasing headphones for more. I use these to plug into my amp. The 2m goes rather quickly when you are plugging into an amp so if you are using them for the same reason I would suggest getting an extension. These would be great to plug into the back sound port for a computer if you wish to be quiet while gaming or watching videos.

author: V Lee Smith
title: Good headphones for the price.
content: This headphone is functional and works as stated.  I only use headphones when I watch tv on my laptop at night, and the sound quality is good for that purpose.  The price was good too.  The only thing that I personally do not like is that the cord is excessively long.  Some people may appreciate this, but I find it annoying because the cord gets tangled in everything.  All in all, though the headphones are a good quality for the price.

author: Stuart
title: if you want better then spend more
content:
I really don't understand why people are giving these Headphones negative remarks, they cost less than $15, if you want better then spend more.
For the price they are pretty good headphones with decent sound quality. Sound was a little better than I expected. Yes they are lightweight but who wants something heavy on their head. Build quality was as I would expect for a set of headphones at this price.

If you are heavy handed, not very careful with your belongings then maybe you should be looking at a stronger more expensive pair of headphones but if you look after things and are careful you should easily get your $15 worth out of them. Anyone expecting better than this for less than $20 is either living in a dreamworld or is the type that wants something for nothing. Very good for the price.

author: PD
title: For the Price, NO Brainer for Casual Listening
content: I'm not an ear-bud guy, I like the old fashioned lightweight headphones. The Sony's are getting phased out, so I tried these and couldn't be happier. They are comfortable to wear (and I have a big noggin) and sound as good as expected watching vids on my iPad or listen to music while doing other stuff on it. I know "sounds good" is totally subjective and FWIW, I do audio editing and mixing on PreSonus Studio One software with a $350 pair of studio headphones, so for casual listening I expect something pretty decent. These fit the bill ESPECIALLY considering the price.

author: KLTmom
title: Perfect for this 80's girl!
content:
I had a pair of Sony headphones like these that recently broke; I had them for so long and used them  so much over the years that one side of the adjustable headband part just started sliding and not clicking and staying in place, so the foam part that goes over the ear would constantly slip down past my ear.  We had several other headphones already in our house--Apple Earpods, Over The Ear Sony ones (the ones with the big puffy, pillowy circles that make you look like you're wearing Princess Leia hairbuns), but I don't like wearing in-ear headphones/earbuds (they're tend to fall out of my ears, no matter what) and the hairbun ones make my head and neck ache, seriously.  They're just too big for lil' ol' me.
What I really wanted were my 80's style headphones back.  The ones I grew up with, attached to my Walkman while listening to my cassette tapes, when I wasn't using my Boombox!  Thank goodness I found these.  I tried the cheapo versions (read: low-cost no-name brand ones from a certain large retailer whose name we won't repeat here in the hallowed halls of Amazon, but whose name begins with a "W" and ends in a "mart").  But these Panasonic ones are basically the same price as the cheapo ones I found at "W", but are clearly a better quality all around.

So if you're an 80's kid like me and love these style headphones, I highly recommend these--good price, good sound, good quality.  I'm going to order another pair!

author: Joe D.
title: Panasonic RP-HT21 Headphones
content:
I have been using these headphones for 3 months.  They are comfortable and durable. I am using them in my Sangean DT-120 radio.  The cord is about 4 feet long so you can put the radio in your pocket and still havde plenty of length remaining.  The headphones are adjustable to fit various head sizes.  I have worn them over a hat.  The main disappointment is the sound level.  The stereo quality is adequate, but I have to turn up the volume on my radio to almost full to get a suitable listening level when outside to compensate for outside noise (traffic etc.). By comparison, my Sony earbuds give the same sound volume at 1/4 of the sound level on my radio.  These headphone have a high impedence level (24 ohms).  Could this be the cause?  I'm not an electronics expert, but I have not seen this high of an impedence on other headphones.

To conclude, the headphones were very cheap. Less than $5.00.  For the money they are a good buy.  If you intend to use them for talk radio or listening to sports, they will done fine.  If you intend to listen to music, then I would invest in better quality.

author: Brian
title: Best Value and Low cost headphones I ever had!
content: I owned 3 pairs of these, 1 broke after 2 years of usage due to the constant high abuse of these headphones. These headphones are the cheapest quality headphone I ever owned in terms of sound being great for the cost, comfort ability being light as feather compared to standard headphones, and COST as cheap as quality dirt. On a serious note, I abuse these headphone tug them in weird angles out of ports, throw them around, step on them and surprisingly only broke one in a couple years. Overall great headphones for cost and value at this price range.

author: Matt Daddy
title: Good quality. As described.
content: I bought these for my son (11). He doesn't like ear buds and "normal" headphones squish his ears. These fit over his ears and he likes the fit. He went through several pairs of buds and headphones that kept tearing up, but these have lasted him for a while. The cord hasn't gotten kinked up as was the norm for previous devices. He uses these headphones with his chrome book, tablet, Nintendo DS, and portable DVD player

author: Janice Ford
title: Very narrow, painful to wear with glasses.
content:
While the description claims that the headband is wide and comfortable, the fact is that this is a blatant lie; the headphones are very narrow ear-to-ear, not wide enough for a human head, and thus press tightly and painfully.  They can be worn for up to half an hour or so without issue, but beyond that, the continued pressure makes them extremely uncomfortable.  Additionally, the sound quality is very low compared to other headphones I've used at a similar price.

Update: After several months of having to use these, they're still uncomfortable, but much less painful and could finally be used for a reasonable length of time after about two months of adjustment.  However, they are exceptionally flimsy; one side of the headphones refuses to remain the same length, and just slides freely, meaning they have to be adjusted every single time they're taken off or put on.

author: FishTech
title: Great headphones for the price
content: Updated Review: I'm giving these headphones 5 stars because of what they are and what they cost.  Are they the best headphones out there?  Absolutely not but they're not advertised as being the best are they?  They're not noise cancelling but I've purchased 7 sets so far because they are a great deal.  I've used them at work in an office and I can still hear the phone ring and the sound quality is great for use with my smartphone or my work PC.  If you don't want to spend a lot of money you'll be very happy with these headphones.  There are better headphones out there but you're also not going to get them for the cost of these headphones.  They don't last forever but at this price I get very good mileage out of them and I look for them again when I need a new economy headphone.  The sound quality is great for the price as well.  Once of my favorite PC accessories!  Thanks Panasonic.

author: Minerva Bryant
title: Not bad. Not bad at all.
content: My daughter bought my grandson Beats last year and  unfortunately everyone used them. She has again purchased these this year but warned him not to allow anyone to "borrow" them. I purchased a set of these for myself and have enjoyed them very much. The stero sound is excellent and I have enjoyed listening through them. I have a Kindle Fire and (I carry it with me always). I am more abt to stay in the car while my daughter goes shopping (my legs ache at times ) and I enjoy a movie or listen to music. I also have an iPhone and watch movies while waiting. I have hearing aids and it's all I can stand for the ear pieces to be in my ears. With this head set it's just perfect covering my entire ears. They are comfortable and you can adjust the fit for a small or large head (smile). The sound is very good and there is a handy volume control on the wire? (For lack of a better word.) Don't be fooled by the price. For what it cost...not bad at all.

author: J K C W
title: Comfortable
content: Great little lightweight headphones that don’t go in your ear. Have had them for 4 months and sleep in them ( side sleeper) no problem. Comfortable!

author: Maineiac
title: NYEH...
content: OK is best I can say....for gym use....I lose a lot of water during my workouts and didn't want to invest in something that I'd ruin from perspiration thus my choice here.  Not the worse I've used....certainly not the best.

author: Denny Dederick
title: Lowest Priced Decent Headphones
content: I needed an inexpensive pair of headphones to give to my grandson with the tablet I was giving him for Christmas. He's only nine years old so they didn't have to be Sennheiser's. At nine years old he's not very discerning about sound quality. But I still wanted to get him something fairly decent and not some total junk. I read the reviews on these Panasonics and they seemed to be just what I was looking for. When I received them I was surprised how nice the packaging was. They looked like they would cost a lot more than four bucks. After he got them on Christmas morning I wanted to see what they sounded like so I pulled some music up on his new tablet. I was blown away at how good they sounded for a four dollar pair of headphones. I doubt there's any other 'phones in this price range that could compare with these Panasonics. Once in a while you find something that's really worth more than it's price.

author: Day Trader
title: Great Sound!  Great Price!
content:
Wow! What a great sound for an inexpensive set of headphones!  I wasn't expecting much at this price point and was totally and pleasantly surprised with the great sound coming out of these headphones.  Sound is centered in the mid-range with adequate bass and no shrilly trebles.
These headphones are perfect for listening to music. If you're considering buying an expensive headset, try these first.  You won't be disappointed.

author: Catherine
title: Great, basic earphones
content: I just ordered my second pair of these headphones when my old pair finally broke after two years of use.  Given the incredibly cheap price these usually sell for, I feel they are a great deal.  They get shoved in and out of my cluttered purse and have held together really well.  I use these headphones when I'm working out because ear buds are the devil and I need something that I don't need to constantly readjust.  These stay on my head and allow me to clearly hear the TV or my music.  If you are super picky about sound, these might not cut it for you, but they work great for people who just need something that sounds good and is reasonably priced and reliable.

author: Sam
title: Good sound, especially for the price
content: My husband has pretty much hogged these so I haven't gotten to use them much, but when I did they were pretty impressive for the price! They aren't Bose or Beats quality, but they also aren't $200. Now I can see why he has hogged them lol. My head is kind of small, and they don't seem to adjust that small, but again I don't use them often so maybe they do? The sound quality is good enough that I can deal with it. And if he's happy, I'm happy.

author: Aaron
title: Highly recommend! Sound great! They won't last you for ever, but they do outlast other headphones of the price point.
content:
These  sound great.  They're indeed very light weight. They have a gentle fit so don't hurt your ears squeezing them against the sides of your head etc. They're a lot like the old time Sony Walkman style headphones that came with those little cassette players.

They're probably fairly durable, but I wear these for hours every single day. I buy 3 or so at a time and unbox the next one when I finish the one I'm wearing off. The quickest I've ever finished one off was around 3 weeks, but they usually last 4 months or so.

The bass is there, but not overpowering. It's just right, not too much mid, and not too much high. I'm blind so my computer is talking to me constantly when I'm using it. I'm also profoundly deaf, so wear behind the ear hearing aids. These fit well against the aids if I turn them around backward. The downside to that is the stereo field is reversed. The flat pads on these don't try to wrap around your ear or cancel out environmental sound. They are very gentle in terms of causing hearing aids to experience feedback. I can wear them for many hours without getting tired of having them on. They don't press the backs of my ear against the aid and produce sore spots and the like.

The cable is not overly thick, not ridiculously thin either - probably just about right for the price. The plug is an l shaped, sticks out of your device about 1 cm before the 90 degree turn, then the sleeve ends 7/8th of an inch. The wire splits about 14 inches from the earphones with a little plastic gizmo that does not slide up or down. It sends one wire to each earphone.

The earphones are on a slide thing that's in the headband, you can slide them out for a bigger head. I always keep them all the way slid in, that's the best fit for my hearing aids. All the way slid in, worn backward with the headband tilted way forward and nearly on my forehead. If it sounds  weird it's because it is, but it works, and works for many hours every day.

If I want to complain, it would be that I kind of wish they had a straight plug, with a short jacket on it, and I wish they had an integrated decent quality microphone. I've driven myself crazy trying to find a headset that looks sort of like these do, has flat pads, sounds ok, will sit on my hearing aids, etc, etc, while having a  microphone that, a: doesn't have a short and allow the person on the other end to hear my computer talking as though it's actually their computer talking, even though I'm freaking wearing headphones, and b: refuse to sound decent.

The most common failure point for these have been one or the other of the earphones will become quieter. Once or twice one will completely stop working and I can affect it by pushing the cord up into the bottom of that earphone, but usually it just grows quieter. This is most often after a few hundred hours of usage though, and I'm not disappointed. For the price, I honestly don't think these can be beat in terms of durability and sound quality. They're above average any way I slice it for sound quality. They won't hold up against Bowse and the like but they're quite impressive anyhow.

author: Madeline Williams
title: These Panasonic Headphones Work Very Well
content:
I bought these Panasonic headphones at the same time as the Koss KPH7 Headphones. I wanted a cheap pair of headphones that were lightweight and fit comfortably. Here is my comparison:

1. Sound Quality: These Panasonic ones win. The bass is better and the sound is clearer.

2. Comfort: Koss won this one, by a small margin. They are both very comfortable, but the Koss ones were so comfortable, I could probably wear them for hours without needing to take them off.

For the incredibly low price, I feel like both these Panasonic ones and the Koss ones were worth buying.

UPDATE: About 5 months after I bought these, the sound started going out. The headphones now have that problem where the audio goes out in one side when you adjust the volume level. I can only set the volume at very loud or very quiet if I want both sides to work. Overall, I'm not surprised, given the price. I feel like I've gotten a good use out of them - but they're definitely not very durable.

author: Kindle Customer
title: issue with plug on cord, and my solution
content:
One reason I bought this headphone was to use it with smartphone when walking outdoors.  I had been using a headphone with ear buds but they tend to fall out of my ears, so I bought this.  As soon as I opened the package and tried to plug this  Panasonic XBS RP-HT21 headphone into my phone, I realized it was not going to work because the plug on the cord would not fit into the phone's jack with the protective case I keep on my phone.  So, at that point, I was thinking I simply would not be able to use this headphone in the way I had hoped.  But, later, I thought of a possible solution; I tried it and it solved the problem for me.  What I did was use a utility knife to carefully cut about 1/16" of the outer black covering on the plug, thereby exposing the white inner wire casing (see photo for a picture of this). Since this reduced the diameter of the plug near the jack on my phone, I was then able to get a proper connection when connecting the cable to my phone.

Edit (4/3/19): Just thought I'd add that sound is quite good for such an inexpensive headphone.

author: Ivan Nuñez
title: Sound quality 90% +  Durability 75% = $8 worth it
content: let me start off by saying that I’m a huge audiophile ( I’ve owned grados 80 e , bose quietcomfort 30 , bose sports earbuds, beats solo etc ) these were above $100!! And I’m all I’m saying for $8 these are valued much more for the sound quality. BUT after a few months I’d say 4 months of using these the right speaker wore off :( it made me a little frustrated because I used these every day ! But then I had to re assure my self that these only cost $8... so I’m definitely buying them again and going to try to guard them more and see how long they last. So sound quality I do have to give it to them for $8 it’s really good. There’s a little sound leak btw but only if you blast it of course.

author: DG
title: Excellent set with one persistent fault - internal cord breakage.
content:
An excellent, lightweight set that comfortably fits a wide range of head sizes. Well matched to cell phones, MP3 players, etc.

However, it has one Achilles Heal: The right-angle 3.5mm plug at the end of the cord is prone to internal breakage.
All these reviews citing one speaker going out unless you hold the cord just right, or one speaker dying after a few weeks, are probably due to this weakness.

I've owned 5 pairs over the past few years and all have died for this reason. Mine last from 6 months to a year.

Years ago they were $2.50. The price has crept up but the cord quality has not.

Given this serious limitation, an otherwise excellent unit.

author: moufee
title: Can't beat it for the price
content: These headphones are lightweight and sound great for $6. Compared to the AmazonBasics on-ear headphones, they feel lighter and are much looser around the head. This makes them more comfortable but they can slip off if you are moving around while wearing them. I've ordered several pairs and they are all still working.

author: Blee1
title: SURPRISING SOUND FOR THE PRICE
content: Surprising set of "inexpensive" headphones that I use to monitor sound while doing video shoots.  As such, I don't mind if these get lost or stolen since the price point is right.  The biggest surprise is the bass response.  Although it is not as deep as my Bose, it is impressive. The mids and highs are right there also.  Additionally, the cable plug is an L and quite durable. For the price, it is an extremely good buy.  These are "over the ear" and are quite comfortable.  I don't expect the foam pads to last forever but so far these are great.  No complaints and I won't cry if these get lost.

author: playerdark
title: Good sound and don't get hot
content:
Better than I expected! These are very inexpensive speakers but I can listen to music on my computer, pretty loud music too without too much distortion. For an open speaker system of that price category they are really extraordinary.
You could think about a bigger and better set of closed headphones but for me one of the main reasons for buying them was that I need to wear them for hours and closed headphones really get hot. These I can wear for a long time without them bothering me. The spring tension is also not too high so they don't squeeze my head either.

author: Dan J
title: Used mainly in school
content: We bought this for our daughter to put into her back pack to take to school and use it at school. Nowadays kids use it in the language lab, and with Chromebooks, and computers in their classroom. Everyone has to bring their own headphones. She has been using them for 1-1/2 years in school. They fit her head nicely and there is no audible distortion in the sound quality. Would definitely buy them again, but hope they last many years.

author: A Customer
title: Broke during first use
content: I bought these for my 11 year old to use for school. They broke with the first use. I ordered them over summer when I did my back to school shopping, so by early Sept, we are already past our return window. Do not recommend.

author: ClassicEndurance80
title: Panasonic does it again!
content:
These are such great headphones for the money.,They were purchased as a Christmas present for my father. They sound great and are comfortable to wear, I might buy another set for myself.

In the past my family would only purchase electronics made by Panasonic because we knew the quality was always there. Times have changed but its good to know that Panasonic still makes a good product.

author: S'noflake
title: that were not nearly as good. I have purchased several more since then and ...
content: I have been a fan of Panasonic's lightweight headphones for a long time.  I got my first set with a Panasonic portable CD player, probably about 1990 or so.  A relative had a set of Sony lightweights, at the time, that were not nearly as good.  I have purchased several more since then and they have all been excellent.  They all still work, but a couple are glued back together due to accidental damage.  When I went out to find replacements for them I tried a number of much higher priced phones that didn't sound as good, in my opinion.  I play solo acoustic guitar and I want phones that accurately reproduce the guitar's sound.  These phones do it well.  They have a good bass without it being overpowering.  I think that they are the best bang for the buck out there. I just purchased a set of Koss KPH7 headphones that cost nearly as much but aren't nearly as good as the Panasonic phones. The Koss phones have poor volume and no bass.  I plan to buy another set of the Panasonic phones soon.  I don't think there is anything out there that sounds so good for the price.

author: MrBob
title: Almost!
content:
So what can you expect in the mobile accessories that cost less than $6.00. I don't know where in Amazon I saw these headphones. Maybe the outlet store which I check from time to time. Oh okay I said to myself. Why not. Really decided to give the set to my granddaughter as a stocking stuffer for this coming Christmas. The set arrived today with a few other items. I pulled them out of the box and set them aside. I really wanted to try them out but as most stuff these days they are shrink wrapped and opening them would had destroyed any chance of gift giving. I am handicapped and retired and found myself with free time on my hands and those headphones began calling me. What the heck. I couldn't control myself and I tore the package apart and reasoned that I could always order another pair. Very flimsy to say the least. Plastic plastic and plastic. Very light but  figured they may be more comfortable that way. Plugged them in my phone turned on Amazon Prime Music and placed them on my head. There is a left and right phone so make sure they are put on right. Chose my favorite tunes on and WOW! I couldn't believe the sound these little guys produced. Just as good as my more expensive phones and much better than my expensive ear buds. I still can't believe what I'm hearing. Excellent. Yes they are wired but so what. I still can't believe the quality of the sound. Not too much base and the mid range and highs all were great. I'm not an audiophile by any means but I know what my ears like. This would had received 5 stars except for a couple of minor details. The cord is too long. It tangled horribly. The second problem is a bit more daunting. The jack is a bit short and because of my phone protective case doesn't stay plugged in.

All in all a great pair of ear phones. Buy! You'll enjoy and for $6.00 where can you go wrong.

author: MusicManMorris
title: These are so awful that I'm actually mad at them!
content: These are pure garbage. Even clone apple earbuds of the cheapest sort are miles better than these. It's like engineers at Panasonic were tasked with making the worst sounding headphones in history. Buy them as gifts for your enemies, those you hate sincerely. Not worth $1. I may give you a dollar to take them away from me. Amazon was awesome about the return, as always. Panasonic... wtf???

author: Maria P. Mason
title: Great little headphones with nice sound.  Excellent price!
content: These are great little headphones. Super comfortable and the sound is far better than what I expected.  For the money I spent on them, I  don't think I could find better.  I use a chromebook and was not sure if these would be compatible. I asked for help with this online and was pleasantly surprised by the number of people who gave me answers and opinions. Amazon is such a great pleace to shop.  Thanks to all that helped me choose these headphones.  I would recommend them to anyone who is looking for affordable, and comfortable headphones. They are exacty as advertised. No frills but very nice sound. Not tinny and more bass than I expected. Nice long cord as well. I bought two pair and so glad I did!

author: survivor '07
title: These are still the best inexpensive headphones I have found
content: These are still the best inexpensive headphones I have found. The old one I have had for several years and they are still working perfectly - I  bought these just to have another pair (at this price, why not?) I personally like the snug fit on the ears. I use them with the TV. Still comfortable after wearing for 2 hours of viewing.

author: Max
title: Not comfortable, sound okay, decent looking
content: The headphones are not comfortable to wear, they are much like the cheap ones you get on an international airline flight.  I feel like they're squeezing my ears when putting them on and too loose on the crown of the head. However the price is so cheap so I can't complain. You get what you pay for. The sound quality is what you would expect from a cheap set of headphones. It looks pretty decent given how cheap it is. Overall it does the job for me in the office.

author: Audrey
title: Good cheap headphones
content: First of all, I don't see why there is a rating choice for battery life on this review. These headphones don't have a battery. They plug in. I used them on a plane and I gave them three stars for noise cancellation because I couldn't hear the on flight movie very well over the plane's engine. I could have turned it up to max, but I was getting a headache. The sound quality was good as far as I could tell. I was glad to have them because I hate earbuds.

author: Nyra
title: Pleasantly suprised!!
content:
I bought these headphones for two purposes: to listen to music at work and while jogging.

WORK:
I plug my headphones into a 2 foot extender which plugs into the headphone jack of the computer. I've noticed no loss of sound quality.

The very first time I put these on and watched a demo video, I was shocked at the "surround sound feel", so much so, I looked around, thinking someone else was playing a video. The sound is VERY clear, you can hear all instrumentation in the background. On my old cheapy headphones, I had to have the volume at least 10-12 bars high to hear, with these, 3-4 bars will do perfectly. This shows the large range of volume these have.

I was pleasantly surprised that the ear "piece" actually swivels in and out for a better fit to your head. It took a week to get used to the large, flat cushioned ear piece (it kind of smashed my ear), but I barely notice now.

CON:
I thought the wide head band would fit better on my head, but for some reason, even sitting still at a desk, these still slide backwards on the smallest setting. The surface is extremely smooth, no grip, which is probably the reason. It's the only annoyance I have with these.

JOGGING/EXERCISING:
I had some slippage as well while jogging, but again, will have to play with the adjustments. Note: The ear cushions are large and if you sweat a bit, this will make it a bit uncomfortable as they will get wet. (However, it's better then ear buds constantly falling out of your ears)

All in all, these are PERFECT for the price of a basic user. I'm VERY happy with my purchase.

author: W. C. Eby
title: These are how much again? Mind blown!
content:
I use earbuds most of the time now. I had been disappointed with on the ear headphones sound quality, and over the ear headphones are too bulky, and press in on my glasses. I bought these for my 3 year old for a trip on an airplane. My 6 year old wanted to use my over the ear headphones I use for editing, and I was okay with that, I didn't use them often anymore. When I took them out to use them, the pads and headband had deteriorating plastic covers, and I wound up putting them away, and they will probably get thrown out. So I went to the local store for a cheap pair of RCA headphones.

Well, when it was about time for the trip, I unpacked them both and tested them. These blew me away. The bass was amazing. And compared to the RCA headphones, it was no contest. My 6 year old cares enough that he wants to use them.  The 3 year old will use the RCAs, and will probably be happy. I will probably use earbuds, or my Sony a35s, as I have been, but I won't be afraid to use these in the future, if the 6 year old will let me.

author: BTLOMS
title: The worst headphones. Very poor quality.
content: These are the worst headphones I have ever bought. I used to buy Sony before. I thought these Panasonic would be better because of the larger diameter. These are such horrible quality that I am beginning to suspect these are fake Panasonic. I am returning the headphones. Sounds like its playing through a cheap radio. Low and High frequencies are missing. Lower midrange is also missing.

author: Margaret Gayle
title: Comfortable, good sound, useful cord length
content: I wanted a long cord so that I could sit or lie on the sofa and listen to audiobooks on my CD player, which sits several feet away on an end table. But, I also didn't want to spend a fortune. This product worked great on all counts. The earphones are very comfortable, the sound is good, the cord is just the right length so there's no tugging or tangling, and this choice didn't injure my budget.

author: Audrie
title: Love these little guys!
content: I love these little guys! I've continually had a pair for about 5 years--but have had to purchase a few (my son "borrowed" one set, gave one to another kiddo, someone stepped on a set and broke, etc). You will not find anything at this price with the same quality of sound, and they're very comfortable. I hate things in my ears, and I like that these sit ON your ears without ensconcing/encompassing them. Because they're so affordable, I don't worry about wearing them to work on spraying paint, or other dirty projects which is when I need headphones the most, to listen to audible books or music. Also, they really are quite well made--I've had the same pair floating around, being abused and manhandled and still working like new for over 4 years!

author: Benjamin Janssen
title: An amazing value under 7.00 USD.
content:
At under 7.00, these headphones sound incredibly clear with excellent bass.
I use these with a Sanza Fuze, and an iPod Classic 160gb when exercising.
The Apple ear-pods would do well to sound 1/3 as good as these.
And on the Sanza Fuze 4gb (which is the best sounding portable) the sound is oh,
so satisfying. Not audiophile quality, but  way better than your typical ear-buds.
Safer too, if you're out running a few miles. (don't play them too loud and you
will be able to hear people or cars approaching)

And at a sub-7-dollar price, these phones can be replaced painlessly.
Amazing value!

author: Neil Talbott
title: Teacher review: they’re great, keep an eye on price.
content: Held up well in a middle school classroom for a year. Way less gross than earbuds and less likely to walk off (still had to replace a couple). Sturdy (none were broken) and fairly comfortable. Best value I’ve found for them. Watch the price because I’ve been able to get them for as low as $6 but sometimes they got a bit higher.

author: CLFMLF
title: Can't beat these headphones
content:
Had the first opportunity in this crazy week (it's only Wednesday night and the headphones arrived promptly on Monday) to write a review.

I used the headphones on both my Iphone 6 and my older laptop and the sound is awesome. In fact, I thought I had the headphones plugged into my Iphone when I played something on my laptop and my husband came running into the bedroom from the living room because it was so loud. LOL

The price was amazing and it was an add-on item to I believe a $25 purchase. I had to order Ensure for my 89 year old father so that was not a problem.

I do not like ear buds because they never fit my ears right and fall out. I like having the headphones over my ears for best sound for me.

You can't beat this item for the price and the quality of sound.

author: JTroth
title: Very impressive for $5
content:
I got these so I could listen to music and videos without disturbing those around me, I wasn't worried about sound quality and just needed something that could play sound and not get in my way, and was concerned that for $5 I would get a piece of crap. Well, I was wrong and the RP-HT21's have me sold. While the bass on these headphones is not powerful, as expected, shockingly everything else about the sound quality (to my untrained ears) is more than satisfactory. I remain using my expensive headphones for high quality sound largely for psychological reasons.

They have not broken or otherwise failed since I bought them 8 months prior to writing this review. I can hear audio from 40 Hz to 14500 Hz on a frequency spectrum video (http://youtu.be/qNf9nzvnd1k) with no quiet or dead zones. (I can hear from 25 Hz to 17000 Hz from my more expensive ATH-M50's and I am convinced that is my natural hearing range)

author: Stone Dog
title: Inexpensive, but work fine.
content:
I bought these so I can watch and listen to Youtube videos on my laptop or Chromebook while everyone else is watching television without bothering them.

They fit okay, have okay adjustments and decent sound quality. I bought the cheapest I could find and they are reasonable for the investment. They're not Bose-quality sound...but don't have that Bose price tag either.

Still and all, a good pair of headphones for only a little money.

author: Bob K4TAX
title: Nice inexpensive headphones
content: These headphones are plastic and are, in comparison to others, inexpensive.  They do sound good and will serve our needs in monitoring the PFL and AM Broadcast with the church sound system.  If they last a year or two, then they are well worth the $20 spent.  Treat them with care and they should last a long time.  Be rough or careless with them and you'll find they will break.  There are no parts to repair or replace.  We've used expensive ones and they only lasted 2 years before the headband broke.

author: Joseph
title: Bang for the buck
content: I ordered these to test out, for live bands to wear while they are recording together...i didnt want to spend a lot on cans that are just gonna get broken by some dingus. I wasnt expecting these to sound good at all, but when i hooked em in and the music hit, it sounded pretty great! Better than my beats, by 20x. They are comfortable too. Went ahead and ordered 4 more pair. 😎

author: 1forestdweller
title: Liked But Didn’t Last
content: I used these in place for TV watching or Stereo. I liked the sound quality but out of the blue in the volume control area the cord got finicky and cutout sound on left side rendering them not useable. Liked the no tangle lengthy cord but once it started cutting out it was like any poorly manufactured cheap headphone on Amazon that has no longevity. Lasted alittle longer than worse ones on Amazon but wiring quality for something that isn’t misused is a waste of money.

author: Scylla
title: Loose plug on an okay headset ruins these. (model RP-HT227-K)
content:
Edit: Please note that this review is showing up on multiple models of Panasonic headphones, and may not be relevant to the one you're actually looking at. (Not okay, Amazon.) I only realized this when trying to review a better model brought me here.

I think the model# of the set I panned was RP-HT227-K, for the record.

The sound on the pair I received is pretty good for a lightweight headset. Which is why I really hate to have to downrate and return them because the plug is junk. It doesn't socket snugly, so the slightest bump or movement, even as simple as turning the phone upside down, causes static, partial loss of sound, or often a complete stop of the music (because playback pauses automatically when the phone detects the headset disconnecting).

I've had some touchy plugs in my lifetime, but this one takes the cake. Unless you plan to remain perfectly motionless or duct tape the plug semipermanently in place, this issue makes an otherwise passable headset about as useless, especially with a mobile phone, as a portable CD player with no antishock.... for those of us who remember that "fun".

Note: I've used four other light headsets with this Android phone (six, if you count headsets with mic for calls, rather than listen-only), of different brands and designs, some of which I still own for current comparison. None of them had or have this issue. There's no question that the fault is with the plug, and not the socket.

It's disappointing, because the sound is fine, and they're comfortable, without the painful and poorly executed excess of bass that's become so common in lightweight headsets. :/ Back to the search...

author: DFB
title: Will not work with certain phone cases. Great headphones for the money.
content: Great headphones for the price. Sound is decent. I really like the felt fabric on my ears vs the plastic coverings. They are also super light in weight. HOWEVER, beware that the tip might not work with your case. They will not fully connect to my phone due to the hard cover case,. They DO fit well with my son's Otterbox case. His has the flaps that cover the ports for protection.

author: JMF
title: Cheaply made, bad sound
content: The package was already damaged when arrived. Not a big deal. When I removed the headphones and went to put them on my head, one of the earphones snapped off due to the cheap plastic. I did try listening y them anyway to hear the sound quality. There is no noise cancellation to speak of. The bass is pretty shallow and the treble is crackly. If you’re an audio file, don’t bother. Actually if you want to put these things on your head at all without breaking, stay away from them.

author: Melissa Hood
title: Great for moderately-severe deaf kids! Good noise canceling as well!
content: My 9 year old daughter is notorious for breaking headphones. I got tired of spending good money on them. So I decided to get her these for Christmas. Well, she loves them. They are broken yet. Which is a surprise. The sound quality is great. They're comfortable. When I put them on, I can't hear anyone talking to me. My daughter is deaf (not fully) and she said she can hear clearly without her hearing aids. So that's a plus!

author: Erick C
title: Surprised
content:
For an extremely affordable set of headphones, these are great.

Let's get it out of the way.  These are NOT going to let you hear the intricate sounds of a flute concerto nor is it going to melt the wax in your ears with ground-pounding bass.  These will fold up, slip into a cargo pocket, and, when needed, deliver decent sound from your media player.

I have a medium sized head, based on the baseball caps I have, and these are very comfortable.  No pinching preasure on the sides of my head and the headband doesn't leave the top of my head feeling sore.  The hinges fold with a purpose, no unnecessary looseness or resistance.  When folded, it stays folded.  Finally, because they're on-ear, they wont add pressure to your glasses (causing them to shift).

Overall, I'm very satisfied with these headphones.  If you don't like earbuds or earphones and can sacrifice sound quality for convenience, I'd recommend you take these for a spin.  For as little as 12 bucks, you can get them just to see what they're like.

author: Genevieve
title: Not noise-cancelling, but ok
content: I got these as a cheap alternative while I wait to get my other headphones fixed. These ones are just okay. The sound quality is decent, but they don't muffle outside noise at all, which is a bit annoying when I want to wear these when studying or commuting. Moving the base of the cable, at the jack, distorts the audio, so I have to be careful not to move it when I'm using the headphones.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Light, comfortable, good range.
content: The sound quality is good, so is the fit; nice long cord. However, the volume is a bit low, even when cranked up to the max; disappointing in that regard, especially when watching a movie on a phone or tablet.

author: Sinhibitor
title: 3 years and still the best!
content:
TL;DR
Best, most durable, decent sounding headphones that give so so much value for money.
You don't have to read the entire review. You can just buy and try them out. You won't even feel bad if you don't like them for whatever reason because they cost less than a Subway Footlong.

I bought these headphones in the Spring of 2011 for an astonishing $4.58. That's the most I could afford back then and I wasn't expecting a lot out of them. All I wanted was a device so that my roommates wouldn't have to listen to me practice amateur keyboard.
I was waiting to write the review till something went wrong with these headphones. I am glad I had to wait 3 years! In fact, it's been more than 3 years and today, the pad on one of the sides tore. After thousands of hours of usage, the only thing wrong with them now is that the soft, cushiony pad tore.

Durability: 10/10
These are the most durable headphones. The wire is intact. The headband is intact with its adjustment mechanism working just fine. The earpieces are fine. And all this with its fair share of getting tugged and tangled and dropped and stepped on. Not just the headphones category but considering all categories, I cannot think of a single product that was less than $5 and has been usable for over 3 years.

Comfort: 10/10
They are extremely lightweight; so much so that you could forget you have them on if no sound were playing.
The headband doesn't press on your ears and is sufficiently adjustable.

Sound quality: 7/10
It has a surprisingly soft and rich bass with good, sharp mid and treble sound. It is no Bose or Audio-Technica but neither does it cost as much. It is 1/20th the cost of a Bose AE2. It is also sufficiently loud and the sound doesn't crack at max volume.
All this make them perfect for music, movies, podcasts as well as phone conversations (there is no mic, but still).

author: Nathan
title: perfect for me
content:
I bought this along with the Sony MDR-110LP (also reviewed on Amazon). I bought both to have a backup in case one stops working. In the last few years I've bought at least 6 which have all stopped working.

The Panasonic RP-HT21 and the Sony MDR-110LP are very similar. Both work well and both are about the same price. Also both can be easily adjusted for different head sizes ranging from a small child to an adult. Just gently pull the band on each side and it will expand.

For me both of these headsets work well. However, the sound on the Panasonic may be a bit better. It seems to be a bit clearer like my old headset which cost several dollars more. My old headset stopped working on one side after only a few months of use. Hopefully these will last longer.

For my purposes the Panasonic is perfect. I use it at my desktop daily to listen to mp3s, movies, youtube videos and all sounds on my computer (including an occasional popup advertisement). So far this seems to be the best headset you can find in this price range. However, if you're a music fanatic and must have more sound control perhaps you'll need to spend more on an expensive headset. Most people, however, should find the RP-HT21 to be perfect.

author: Russell Nash
title: Great for price, better sound quality than more expensive headphones
content:
I would give four stars for overall quality within the price range, but the fit is a little odd and these become loose on me from time to time,  hence an overall three star rating.

I have owned $150 pairs of headphones whose highs and lows were not as clear and rich as the sound I get from these headphones.  That is not to say that these are amazing sounding, but they're quite good for the price.

I like that these headphones are lightweight and comfortable.  As stated above, over time worn the headphones often become a bit loose  and require adjustment,  which is an issue I haven't had one other headphones.

My first pair lasted for a good couple of years. I replaced them recently with another which started to show signs of a defect after only a week of use.  That defect is an occasional slight rattling in the left speaker when certain frequencies play.  Amazon was quick with a refund.  I'll probably replace the defective pair as at this price they're worth having a set of.

author: C. Montejo
title: Good Bass Okay Sound
content: I am 13 years old and a music lover at heart. I go through at least 10 pairs of headphones a year, they never leave my neck. I listen to music at all times, accept in school of course. I prefer headphones that increase the bass and cancel sound around you (noise-canceling). These headphones are PERFECT, meaning that you can really hear the bass and not much else around you. The vocals are really good, and the sound comes through very clearly. I have had them for a month so far and they haven't disappointed me. The only thing is that they are made pretty big, and even the lowest setting is really long. I would not recommend them for running, I've tried and they have fallen off. I would stick to earbuds. But for dancing around the house, working, or on a long car ride, these headphones are definitely worth more then the price they are asking for. I am very impressed with the price (it was great to find a good pair of headphones under $15) and the sound quality overall.

author: JandN
title: Few months of use and still good to go.
content: I've had these for a few months now. I use them nearly every day for a few hours a day. I haven't been as careful with them as I should be, but for 7 dollars I can afford not to. They still work. The sound quality isn't as bad as some other cheap brands. On a scale of 1 to 10 with 1 being the worst, I'd give the sound quality of these at least a 6.

author: Lori
title: Nice fit, nice sound
content: I bought these to use with a cheaper TV that has poor sound.  I'm using the TV when I walk on the treadmill and the TV sound couldn't compete with the treadmill sound.  These headphones are great.  They are light weight, adjustable to fit any size head, and the fit is very comfortable -- not too tight.  The headphones don't move around or slip from the motion of walking, the sound is good, and the volume adjustment is handy.

author: MegaReader
title: Small, ON-the-ear (not OVER), flimsy
content: The only plus: the price.  Very inexpensive.  The minuses: They are misrepresented as over-the-ear.  They're not, they are on-the ear (even though all the pictures that show people wearing them clearly show over-the-ear).  Very flimsy.  They are too small - my head's not THAT big, but they squeeze like a vise.  Plus, I figure the head piece will eventually break from stretching it to get them on.  A real disappointment.

author: Marie
title: Good volume control
content: Comfortable. I use for my iPhone. Hearing impaired do volume control and comfort important. This is not the set I bring on a plane to block out engine roar. Great for home use. Good price.

author: Dan B
title: Perfect for the treadmill or elliptical
content:
I wanted decent, inexpensive. on-the-ear headphones for gym workouts.  Various types of earbuds either fall out or get sweat on the diaphragm, which makes them unlistenable until they dry out.  I could have gone with the $299 Beats phones like the NFL pros wear on TV commercials, but that seemed like a good way to waste $299 and quickly ruin nice headphones.  For $8, these are perfect.  They get very sweaty, but there's no degradation in sound quality.  But I imagine I'll have to replace the black foam coverings at some point.  Seems that those are easy and cheap to buy though.  Would Bluetooth be nice?  Sure.  But since I stay put on the treadmill or elliptical, these do the trick and sound A-OK for my gym needs.

Update:  I've now been using them for running, and they work great there too.  They stay put on my head and the cord is long enough that there's plenty of slack (but not too much) from my head to my music player in my pocket.  If I wore my music player on my arm, there would probably be too much slack.

author: westlady
title: For the price a good product
content: My other earphones broke, and I didn't want to spend a lot to replace them, so I just got this inexpensive replacement.  The sound is the only issue I have; it is inferior to even a $15 earphones.  Low bass quality, but then again, I only spent $7, and didn't expect any better.  They are comfortable to wear, although I would maybe not say this if I had a bigger head.  Mine is on the smaller side, and they are very comfy.  I may break down and get a more expensive pair for listening to music, but as a backup or for watching youtube talking heads, these are fine.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great for school!
content: We purchased these for our son for school this year. He has only been using them a month but he is very rough on things and they seem to be withholding. They are very good quality the ear pads are comfortable the sound quality is great and the cable is pretty long. I can update this in a few months to let you know how they are doing haha.

author: Jacob
title: Very, very quiet and very poor quality. I did not like these at all, even for the cheap price.
content: These were unbelievably quiet and extremely uncomfortable. The mesh covers over the earpieces ripped very easily and came off. I knew that I was buying a cheap headset, but I expected to be able to hear music reasonably while I rode passenger in a car, or jogged. These cannot do that. As for sound quality, they were quite tinny and had no bass to speak of. Try turning bass to -10 and treble to +10 on a car stereo or something of the sort; that's what these will alway sound like - assuming you can hear anything at all over the sound of a slight breeze.

author: Storme
title: VERY GOOD SOUND QUALITY BUT THEY SLIP OFF OF HEAD
content: I own several pair and have owned several pairs of headphones.  These rank up there with my very expensive headphones as far as sound quality goes in a small package.  Of course you are not going to beat the big bulky head phones that fit snug on your ears though.  These headphones don't hurt your ears after a long time using them like those in-ear (ear buds) do either.  I would not use these head phones for working out though as the tend to slip off of your head.  The more you sweat and move the more they slip.  It is very bothersome when you are using cables and you lean forward and your headphones slide off of your head and hang while you are in the middle of your set.  Bottom line:  If you are just going to walk or sit and listen to your headphones you can not beat these headphones...especially for the money - you just can't.  Now if you are going to workout or do anything that causes movement and sweating, even yard work, then go with something like the Philips SH390 (inexpinsive around $13.00) that are snug.  Again, you can not beat the Panasoni RP-HT21 for the price - just be worned if you attempt to work out with them.

author: Ron Baker
title: Poor sound, buzzing and rattling
content: Very poor sound quality. I'm not an audiophile but even my layman hearing can tell the sound reproduction of these headphones is poor. On some tones, usually bass, the earphone speakers buzz and rattle. Other tones are simply not clear. In addition, while they do fit over the ear they fit poorly since they are round instead of oblong (you know, like a human ear) I'm returning them.

author: Rich
title: rating based on price, not on being a "great" item
content:
to be fair, i'm rating this item based on the price. the sound quality is not great, but it's cheap, and i use these at work where i basically listen to CNN and various radio talk shows, not much music. hopefully, they'll last a good amount of time that it's worth it. to be determined.

so, for the money, it's a good item. it's very comfortable too, light enough that i barely feel them on my head.

author: Lisa Yang
title: Quite good and sound quality is excellent
content:
Quite surprising set of headphones. Although the volume is very low, it has to be turned up about 35% higher than my other set, the bass and sound stage are really good. It's an all plastic construction so cost is lower, but the sound is very very good.

I bought these as a "kids only" headset since mine destroy earbuds and headphones on a regular basis. These are perfect for them.

I would recommend these to any parent or anyone looking for a set of spare "good" headphones.

author: sopi
title: ok
content: I often stream video to my iPad in bed and sometimes fall asleep with headphones on, so I'm always on the lookout for inexpensive lightweight headphones since they tend not to last very long. Certainly I didn't expect great sound at a price point but these don't put out any bass at all, and I mean absolutely zilch below 120 Hz or so. For me that's a deal killer even for watching movies or TV shows, so I would consider these useful solely for voice applications like audible books (and even there you'll lose some vocal resonance, especially for male narrators). For a few dollars more, Panasonic's RP-HT21 phones sound way better and are also more comfortable to wear.

author: Daniel Sanford
title: Right headphones for the price.
content: They are perfectly fine for the price.  I've had better on-ear headphones with slightly better bass and mid-range, but for 4x the price.  This has good high range, decent mid and bass.  Great for when you want to hear your music, but do not want to be disconnected from your surroundings.  I use these at work.  I can hear people when I need to stay semi-aware of office-mates; and if fellow cube-dwellers are being unnecessarily loud and gossipy, I put earplugs in, and crank the music loud enough to hear it decently.  Note, with the earplug trick, you go from being slightly treble heavy to being notably bass heavy.

author: Therivermonk
title: Dont buy these unless you want to re adjust the size constantly
content: I honestly never got as far as listening to anything with them, the size adjust was so crappy it wouldnt hold once adjusted. Ig you. Touched them they changed size.

author: Ken LaBrie
title: Worth every Penny!
content: I bought five of these for sharing music with a group of people simultaneously.  This headset sounds like a more expensive unit, with plenty of bass, highs and the mid range does not suffer either.  I highly recommend these for occasional use or for multiple purchases or for someone who does not want to lay out a bunch of money for a better sounding pair of headphones.  Sure, I have a bunch of expensive headsets laying around, but each one has it's own power level requirements and you can't give any two of them out and expect the listeners to get the same volume level or eq from these.  The answer for me in this respect, was to purchase at least five sets and distribute the same sound/level to all.  These do the job very well.  I am pleased for the quality and especially the fact I didn't have to lay out the bucks to achieve my purposes.

author: JJS
title: Great value
content: These are inexpensive head phones that I bought to use with my Apple Ipad.  I wear hearing aids and the headphones fit easily over the aids so I don't have to remove them every time I want to listen to the Ipad without disturbing others.  I used ear bud headphones before and I was constantly having to remove and replace the hearing aids.  These headphones have excellent sound quality, they are comfortable and very inexpensive.  Great value.

author: Sherlock
title: great with sony walkman
content: I listen to the radio and NPR while I clean the barn in the mornings. This has a longer wire than the headphones that came with my Sony Walkman radio so I can hook it to my back pocket and the wire can run up through my layers (and layers and layers) of clothing in the wintertime. Then I am not restricted in my movements worrying about the wire. The sound with these is great and the price is right. I would however, suggest a small clip on the wire somewhere to keep the wire from dangling all over as it is long. For me this will be more of an issue when I'll be active in the summertime and wont have the layers of  clothing to keep it in place.

author: Robert G.
title: Made for people who like sound quality without looking like a tool..
content: I hate new headphone designs.. I really don't use head phone like jewelry. I am not a label snob, and i can care less if others hear my music when i walk by.. I love the old school head phone design, they fit over glasses, they aren't a fortune and with MP3 music you get a loss of quality anyway for compression so buying 300.00 headphones to listen to subpar music files makes zero sense to me.. These headphones sound awesome for the price, and i buy a new set every couple years.. they work well.. and for the price.. can't beat them..

author: J. Galgano
title: Gives muffled sound, they don't sit flush ,flimsy, and then one side cut in /out.
content: I was looking for a set of over ear headphones,thought these Panasonic ones would fit the bill. NOPE the don't fit flush against my head. No bass,just a muddy muffled sound. Tried on my laptop and home stereo. Same cheap sound. So I left them playing for a few hours to see if they needed breaking in. Nope. Then one of the phones cut out when i moved around my room. Maybe I got a used or defective pair?  Sent Back. Going to stick with the Koss KTX1 titanium. Those have awesome sound and they cost less.

author: Ash
title: DEFECTIVE AND CANNOT BE RETURNED
content:
YOU CANNOT RETURN THIS ITEM IF IT ARRIVES DEFECTIVE.
These headphones in and of themselves aren't bad. They're comfortable, somewhat sound-canceling. The sound is not crisp--it's fuzzy--but it isn't terrible. The problem was that the very first time I used them, the sound in each speaker cut in and out as I walked. Poor wiring somewhere. So I tried to return it. NO DICE. This item is not eligible for returns on Amazon. You have to contact Panasonic themselves via phone. I did so. Panasonic said they would only do exchanges, not returns, and I had to contact Amazon (and by the way, Amazon's customer service phone number is 1 (888) 280-4331 and they were lovely). It was the only way to get a refund. Buying this product is obviously a crapshoot. I wouldn't risk it.

author: E.M.
title: They're truly lightweight and fit nicely in my purse or backpack
content:
I have carried these or their equivalent since I was in high school. I've tried other headphones, and I keep coming back to these.

Ear buds, even more expensive earbuds, hurt my small ears. Larger on-ear and over-ear headphones are awkward, bulky, and can give me headaches.

I always end up returning to these. They're truly lightweight and fit nicely in my purse or backpack. They fit my iPhone and iPad (I'm sure Apple would have something to say about buying proprietary Apple headphones but I've never had a compatibility issue and they've never damaged any of my Apple equipment.) They fit our old portable DVD player. My daughter has also stolen them for her Innotab on occasion. I have even used them on my computer when I couldn't find my better headphones.

As others have noted, the sound quality is top notch for something so small and inexpensive. Bass is nice. Everything sounds rich, nothing sounds tinny. They don't fall off but they don't squeeze my skull to the point of headaches, and the adjustable headband is easy to move but remains solid wherever I adjust it.

You cannot beat these little things if you're going to be taking your music with you.

author: Michael
title: Pair Nicley with Earmuffs for DIY Passive Noise Cancelling Headphones
content:
These headphones don't have built in subwoofers because they're not the size of over the ear headphones, but the sounds that come through these headphones for the price is pretty unreal.

I'd say I'm an amateur audiophile and I actually put these drivers/earpads in a pair of Safety Ear Muffs 34dB Highest NRR, Shooters Hearing Protection to make a pretty quality pair of noise cancelling headphones.

I don't particularly like the feel of over the head plastic bands on headphones so if I were to rate the product for exactly as it was intended, it would probably be a 4 star review, but for my needs they're fantastic at the price.

author: S. Anderson
title: Not Over-the-Ear Headphones
content:
Update 7-30-19: These really are crap, they break very, very easily. The only reason I have tried these more than once is they have the inline volume control, which I find I prefer for my job. But I can't keep buying these every 3 months. Would not buy them again.
I should have read the questions and answers section and it would have confirmed before I bought that these are not "over-the-ear" headphones. They sit on the ear.  I was searching specifically for over-the-ear to keep out most sound. With that said, they are very comfortable and adjustable. If they had been as advertised I would have provided 5 stars instead.
UPDATE:  This pair only lasted only about 6 to 7 months before the sound started fading in and out on one side. Unless I can get a replacement real cheap I wouldn't buy these again.
UPDATE: My second pair broke so these do not last more than a year for each pair. I won't buy another pair.

author: Valenta
title: Not for smartphones or tablets
content: This product is only good for portable radios and CD players. I will not recommend this product to use on a smartphones or tablets. I will not recommend these type of headphones for these specific products, because with my smartphone the volume was low, and it also interferes with the voice activation commands on my phone. When I decided to use them on my tablet these headphones did not work at all. Even though I had problems would these type headphones using my smartphone, and tablet, they work well on my portable CD player.

author: Michael White Buffalo
title: A GREAT INEXPENSIVE HEADPHONE - BEATS HEADPHONES TWICE THE PRICE
content:
For an inexpensive, lightweight pair of headphones, the Panasonic RP-HT21 gets my five star vote.

I probably have about 7 pair at any given time around the house - for my computer; in my gym bag for my mp3 player; connected to the television, in my briefcase - anywhere I want to use headphones.

Essentially I love them because:

***The sound is great - they carry more bass than Sony, Koss and other brand of headphones that I've found at the local drug store and have an all-around great range

***They are shockingly economical

***They are fairly well-made - I wear one set during my daily workouts at the gym and they hold up really well - my current set for about 2 years now

The only con, in my opinion, is that, because the cord extends out of EACH earpiece and then connects over the chest area, it's prone to getting tangled pretty easily in mobile situations, like storing them in a gym bag. Still, that's only a minor complaint and not something to lower a five star rating.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Over the ear are better
content:
Sound great but are  very unconfortable after you wear them for a while. The pressure on the earlobes become painful.
Because they sit on the ear the noise canceling is non existent. If your in a quiet area you can reduce the volume if not, you have to be mindful on how loud the volume is. I decide to purchase a new over the ear noise canceling headphone. Very confortable to wear at a lower volume.

author: josh1000f
title: Good sound but they don't last long.
content: These headphones have great sound but the wiring in the plug part is very low quality and doesn't last long under light or normal use. I've owned at least 4 pair for gaming and every one of them has lost sound on one side after after a few months of use. I keep getting them because they sound  good, they're very comfortable, and I like that I can still hear the "outside world" when I'm wearing them. I wish Panasonic would spring for a better plug and fix this issue. I'd happily pay a few bucks more for a pair that lasts longer.

author: C. File
title: The sound is amazing with great bottom end
content: This is my 4th pair of RP-HT21s. They cannot be beat as the "bang for your buck" champion. The sound is amazing with great bottom end. I was shocked the first time I listened to them and could hear so much more in the music. And the best part is the comfort of these headphones. I wear them for hours at my desk and never have any pain in my head, ears, or neck. They just sit there. You notice the great sound but never notice the feel of the headphones. This is coming from a guy with a huge head, I have trouble buying hats because they usually don't fit.

author: Jai
title: Headphone jack doesn't fit through most iPod cases
content:
Dear Panasonic,

The headphone jack is the old style for CD players. Doesn't fit an iPod case which most people use. The 3.5mm plug fits, yet requires removing any iPod case to fully plug, make full connection. Misleading; this should be specified on product page. I had to return these.

This product would be incredible if you'd update the plug to fit through a iPod case and add a microphone to one of the wires, like Apple earbuds have. This way these could be used for calls with an iPhone as well. I prefer to use lightweight over-ear headphones as ear buds put EMFs to far inside my ear, which causes pain. Please make a solid pair of lightweight over-ear headphones with a mic and proper plug for cases.

author: CarefulShopper1
title: Very Inexpensive, But Not Good For Music, Comfort, or Noise Isolation.  I Recommend Paying $10 More For a Better Headset.
content:
These are a very inexpensive headphones that could be ok for listening to talking such as the news or narrated books but they are not good at all for music.  They have a volume control and long cord, but they don't fold up, and the light foam cushioning provides almost no sound isolation.

I would only buy these if I needed to purchase a large number of inexpensive headphones where the sound quality and carrying convenience was unimportant.

If you care about the sound quality, comfort, and convenience I recommend paying an additional $10 and getting the Panasonic Over-the-Ear Stereo Headphones RP-HT227 ($16.99).  Those have great sound with excellent bass, comfortable leather (or leatherette) padded earcups, and fold up into a convenient package.

author: Nom de Plume
title: Way too much sound bleed
content: I bought a pair for my coworker, and now I'm sorry I did.  He is enjoying them, but the sound bleeds over to my cube.  Seriously, it bleeds way too much to be used in an office setting.

author: GR
title: Not bad for the price
content: I had an old pair of these that I always used, same make and model. I had my old pair so long that the ear foam just rotted off. Figured I couldn't go wrong by ordering the exact same thing. Wrong... Something had changed. The sound wasn't as good as my old pair. On the plus side all was not lost. I just took the new pairs ear foam off and put it on my old pair. Don't get me wrong, the sound is not bad for the price, it's just not as good as it used to be.

author: Sam Collins
title: Lasted about one month.
content: These were okay for the time that they worked. You could still hear everyone and everything else as if you were not even wearing headphones which did not work well for the kids to use in the car so the adults could listen to something else or talk. I thought they were good for the money but they broke in about a month.

author: capnkid
title: fit perfect
content: Am happy with this purchase. I had a set of Boise headphones, but they gave up the ghost. I could only hear the limit of my laptops ability. With the panasonic headphones I am able to adjust the volume, so I can easily increase the volume to my desired hearing. That's a great feature. Now, instead of being drowned out by the television (wife's soap operas) I put on the headset, adjust the volume and can hear all my music and youtube videos without tv interruption.

author: D. Hayden
title: Used for sleeping these are great for all-round listening
content:
I sleep in a recliner and these stay on pretty well. I'm comparing the sound to my Sony MDR-V6 that I used in my studio (I still have 2 pair) and in my experience These Panasonic sound good. They don't have the high end clarity, the Sonys are a little hyped on mids and highs (Great for singers) BUT these Panasonic have great bass and enough top end to keep me happy all night while sleeping. I create electronic music, soundscapes and the bass is formidable and the Panasonic even handle the sub bass in a way the I get an almost floor shaking illusion and when
I take them off to check that I didn't leave the speakers that I have for my 5.1 system on (it includes a sub woofer) but no, the Panasonic really have the ability to reproduce that sub bass effect.
 I'm on my second pair, the first lasted for over a year before the headband got loose a natural result from using them every night but the sound remained the same, so I "wore them out" in a way that just made them unusable for my needs.
I highly recommend these little puppies for anybody that needs good bass and don't mind good mids and highs also. Great for anybody really.
Third pair and still loving them.

author: Amazon Customer
title: not bad for a low cost headphone
content:
first i know you get what you pay for the sound is OK at best but for the price it is what it is. Durability
there new but i will be happy if they last 6 months. would hate to wear them more then 20 min at a time they have a bad feel hard on ears. over all if you need a low cost pair of head phones you only need to put on for 30 min or less and cant pay more then $16 they are ok I myself would not buy them a 2ed time.

author: Kae TheOne
title: Love These Earphones--But Wish They Survived ME Better!
content:
I've had two pairs of the Panasonic RP-HT21 Headphones because I pretty much love everything about them. I've read where a couple of reviewers have called them "Good for the price", but in fact, they're a great deal better than a number of different brands of headphones that are considerably higher priced.

PROS: These headphones, while certainly not symphony quality, are more than adequate for an evening's work or play on my computer, or with my phone and mp3 players. They're lightweight, they're comfortable in the extreme, and I'm impressed with both their higher and bass ranges, sound-wise. Though they're probably considered "open air" phones, they do quite a good job of blocking out outside sounds, since they cover most of the ear. Unless it's awfully hot out, they also breathe pretty well, and so don't overheat my ears, even if I've been wearing them for a couple of hours.

CONS: The only real "con" I can find with these headphones is that they don't survive ME very well! As I said, this is the second pair of RP-HT21's I've owned, and it's the second pair I've broken an earphone off of! The first pair took it in the neck, so to speak, when I accidentally stepped on them (barefooted, and it wasn't a full-weight crunch, either); the second pair got sat on while on the bed. My fault in both cases, and a bit of tape will hold them together this time. Still, though they still "wear" fine, every time I pull them off now, I have to put them back together.

Despite this con, these Panasonic RP-HT21 Headphones are worth way more than their price; indeed, they'd be more than worth it at TWICE their price. I will definitely be getting another set of them.

In fact, I think I'll buy a FEW pairs this time!

author: cameronhudson8
title: Even though they only lasted 5 months, they're still a pretty good deal.
content: I was really happy with these until they broke after 5 months of daily use. Although they don't fold, they're small and easy to pack away. The sound quality is phenomal for the price point. They connect to any device I have. Even if I go through a pair every 5 months, after 4 years, I'll have only spent 60 USD, which is still not bad for headphones for this quality that are this portable.

author: Matt
title: Simple Headphones With Great Sound and Price
content:
When I was purchasing other items that I wanted/needed, I came up short on getting the $25 minimum for getting the free shipping.  I was only a few cents short and I didn't want to have to spend another $3 to $5 in shipping, so I began to look around for little things that I would have considered nice to have just so that I could get another item for that money.  I was very lucky to stumble upon these headphones as they have quickly become my favorite item from that group purchase.  What I thought would have been just a nice, keep to the side just in case item, have become my favorite headset to use on the computer and I use them everyday.

These Panasonics were incredibly cheap when I purchased them (around that $3-5 range) but the quality and sound they have are incredible for that price point.  I have not had a problem with discerning any kind of sound from videos, games, sound effects, etc. They are also very comfortable as the ear portions can slide very far to fit a variety of different head sizes.  The cord is also a good length so that you have a decent amount of room to work with in leaning down from the computer jack or using with an iPod.

I have had no complaints using these headphones and, to be honest, am very surprised at just how good they are.  You can't go wrong with these headphones and especially at the price, consider them a great bargain instead of cheap knock offs.

author: N. Lacher
title: Quality seems to be on the decline.
content: I use headphones nearly everyday for work, so I go though about 4 sets a year. Amazon is the only place I can find earphones like this anymore. I've been buying these Panasonic ones for 3 years now, and have noticed that the quality seems to be getting worse. The over the head part often comes twisted so that the pads don't lay flat against both ears, and/or the headband is so tight that it gives me a headache. I've figured out how to fix this: I heat up the top of the headband using my heat gun until it becomes pliable- but not melted and then quickly pop them on my head to cool off. This seems to fix the issue. I just opened my newest box and after fixing the head band, plugged them into my iPod to notice that the plug cord was touchy- cutting out the audio in one ear, or decreasing the overall quality in both ears when bumped. I'd expect this from a set a few month old- but not right from the box! Very disappointing. So now I have to order a new set....and have to make the choice- get panasonic again, or switch to a different, yet untested manufacturer?

author: L. Long
title: Comfortable Headphones, Fantastic Price
content: For the price, you cannot get better headphones. Earbuds hurt my ears, so I wanted a "headband" style pair that sat on the outside of my ears. I chose the Panasonic RP-HT21 Lightweight Headphones with XBS Port because of the price (<$5) and because there were so many great reviews. Normally, I shy away from super cheap deals because you usually get what you pay for (i.e., cheap deal = cheap product). Not so with these headphones. They are lightweight with a very decent sound, and are extremely comfortable. I had no problems wearing these on a 4 hour flight. My ears never hurt once, and I hardly noticed the headband. Plus, if I do every lose or break them, I won't be upset because of the price. But they seem very durable, and survived a round trip flight and being shoved in my backpack. They've already been used well more than $5 worth, so I feel like it's money well spent. If you need a great set of headphones at a reasonable price, then definitely get these.

author: Rebecca Gibson
title: Great!
content: I was looking for good sound quality with a very long cord.  These work perfectly for both.  No noises are heard outside, so total focus is on what is being listened to.

author: Sam
title: Good Quality, Lightweight, Low Price - Great Choice For Kids
content:
I purchased three of these for my children for a recent vacation (flight). My kids are not very good about being able to keep ear-bud style headphone on, so I thought it might be better to have some on-the-ear style headphones. The headphones were a bit large for smaller heads, but they were able to sit back on the airplane seats and let the headphones rest on the seat.
