When they wanted to lean forward, the headphones would balance backwards and stay in position.

In general these worked great - reasonable loudness and clarity (for the price), lightweight, durable, and great price. Even the three year old liked them and that made the flight easier. I would note that they do not fold, but since I am giving these to the kids to use, they are more likely to break than get lost so I prefer more durability (non-folding). I would definitely buy them again if the need arises.

author: George P. King, II
title: Watch to see if they were deli. This was excellent.Great pack packages excellent products.
content: These headphones work very very well. I use them when I’m in the hospital for my dialysis and allows me to rest and be comfortable. It was delivered on time. The package was excellent. They had people watching the package so that I could Watch to see if they were delivered on time. This was excellent.

author: L. K. Mcarter
title: Lightweight and Inexpensive for Good Quality
content: I bought 2 of these headphones and they work for what I need it for. It could actually compete with other "over-ear headsets with no mic" quite well. It's lightweight than most headsets so it's not uncomfortable on my head. Over-ear really helps me with noise cancellation and concentrate on music or any game I play. For being lightweight, they still have the Panasonic quality as any other Panasonic product. The cord is really long as well, and just what I needed.  I highly recommend this headset for its cost and quality.

author: dman
title: PANASONIC STILL ROCKS!
content: Panasonic is one of the originators when it comes to portable sound devices and their attention to quality is legendary from day one. Many in the portable market consider Panasonic passe  but based on the sound of these headphones I'd say this company is more than holding its own. Though the headphones are light as a feather the clarity of this set brings out all the details for a good listening experience, no booming bass just good clean sound. I personally think headphones should act as headphones and not double as a music setting, let your player handle that part thus allowing the headphones to shine on their own. Panasonic may have taken the back seat these days when it comes to electronics but don't sleep, the attention to high quality product is still there and these phones prove that.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Cost effective, perfectly foldable, great sound
content: For the money you pay this is a perfect set. As a matter of fact we bought these headphones to replace the same model that got retired after a number of years of heavy use. What I like about it is how light it is and feels when it is on my head. Plus it folds perfectly to minimize the space needed for it, perfect for travel. Sound quality is very good for the price. Ability to control sound from the controller, not on the headphones is another advantage, just makes it easier to use. Overall very happy with it. Recommended.

author: Sherri L. Lochner
title: Durable, loud, work well with my iPhone
content:
I love these headphones! My workplace loans out pairs of these for public use and was going to throw a pair out because the ear pads had torn off. I took them, cleaned them off, and used them till they gave out. I loved them so much that I bought myself another pair. They work fantastically, even without the ear pads. They get pretty loud, they give off audio as good as I'm used to (although I'm no audiophile), and the best part is they don't irritate my iPhone! I've had multiple pairs of earbuds that cause the music on my iPhone to pause and play randomly, and trigger Siri at random. It's incredibly annoying--but these headphones never do that! Couple that with how earbuds always fall out of my ears, and these quickly became my go-to listening device. I mostly kept my old pair in my bookbag and purse (two unforgiving locations to keep headphones), and they never seemed the worse for it. The wires finally gave out where each one connects to the earpieces, which I think was due to how at work we always brought the wire up and wrapped it around the earpieces. With how reliable my old pair proved to be, I gladly bought another pair!
One thing about these that could be a turnoff for some people: if you're listening to something loud enough, the people around you can probably hear it too. I've never minded this much (it's only when my music is really loud and it ups the chances of having a conversation with someone about the music I'm listening to), but if privacy or quietness is a concern for you then these might not be the right pair of headphones for you.

author: Liquidtusk
title: The best light headphone EVER!
content:
I ordered these headphones because of previous reviews that said that they were great.
I was blown away by these things. Frequency response of 16HZ to22KHZ, I believe it (We can only hear 20HZ to 20KHZ).
Crisp, no crackle highs, and no distorted lows.
With plenty of POWER! I use these for about 6 hours a day, 7 days a week. they are so comfortable that after the first day of use, i forget they are on, and nearly yank my laptop off of the table! Don't let the first fit fool you when you first put them on. They start out snug, but soon you can't feel them. GREAT SOUND low or high volume, and with all styles of music. From Classical, to Hip Hop, to the guitar gods of the classic rock era. (Rest in piece Ronnie Montrose), who passed on last week. I listened to Town Without Pity, and Rock Candy for hours with these. I think the next set will last much longer, because i do a "headphone check" before I get up from my computer. This is another marriage saving feature. You can hear your wife talk to you, and answer her intelligently, not like buds. I just ordered 2 more of them, for UNDER $10.00 delivered (2 day shipping for free. I love Amazon Prime)!
BUY THESE, AND GET AMAZON PRIME!!! The headphones lasted 6months , until my cat ate the wires. (Oh well, live & learn)...
This quality item for under $5.00 each can't be beat...
Amazon Prime paid for itself in about 4 months of 2 day shipping.
Not to mention that the Prime free video service(Free movie & tv shows streaming when you want them, similar to netflix)!
From music to movies, yummy!

Liquid Tusk.

author: B4T9
title: Very satisfied.
content: This was a surprise.When I put the inexpensive ($6.25) headphones on they were very comfortable and the base was strong. Whatever the ohms means (24 ohms) it seemed louder at the same volume on my mp3 player. I bought a second set the following week. Might buy another for a short-notice gift item. I don't volunteer to write a lot of reviews but I did this time.

author: D.K.
title: Fantastic Sound and Fantastic Price
content: I've been getting these for about $3.50 shipped.  I've been using them as gifts for birthdays, Christmas, etc.  I know people think I shelled out more than that.  When listening to music and especially Celtic Woman videos the sound comes across so clear, vibrant and full I am awestruck.  I've owned more expensive headphones.  My current "good" set cost 20X that on sale and they are better in every way than these.  Except in weight.  My "good" set has very linear response that is awesome too and the HT-21 is base heavy.  That's not always a bad thing.  I can hear the drums and the base line without blowing my eardrums out with the rest of it.  I like that.  The cord is also nicely long, substantial and has an angle plug.  It just doesn't get any better.

author: Some Like To Shop
title: Audio Savior
content: These are my work headphones. You know the ones that drown out Carol and Karen talking loudly about how cute something is rather than doing actual work? Needless to say I need these to work for my sanity to remain in tact and they do their job wonderfully. I go thru multiple sets a year usually because they're used so often but these are showing no signs of retirement yet. Definitely worth the cash to keep coworkers alive until 5.

author: tbyg
title: Very nice for the price, but not ideal for gym
content:
Sound quality and comfort (when you are relatively still) seem good, but not suitable for my purpose (gym).

Much surrounding sound is let in, and you can't crank them up enough to drown it out.  Probably a good thing for my ears.

OK for treadmill, bike, or rower, but impossible for strength training - they slip around if you are not upright.  (Edited to add that today, as I am still waiting for my next try at headphones for the gym to arrive, I discovered that if I push the headband back on my head, as opposed to straight up, they are much more stable.)

Headband a bit large for my head, even at smallest extension.  (On edit - barely the right size if I push them back a bit.  Anybody with a smaller head than mine would be out of luck.)

If you are going to be upright and not moving vigorously, they should be fine, and they sure are cheap!

On edit, raised my rating to four stars - they are quite amazing for the price, and comfortable now that I've discovered how to wear them.  Don't expect high volume, though.

On edit, including a link to another headset I ordered.  Am still deciding which one I like best for the gym.

Sennheiser  HD 202 Dynamic Headphones

author: my revewi
title: I should of listen to the bad reviews, this is not the Panasonic i used ...
content:
I should of listen to the bad reviews,
this is not the Panasonic i used to know, i have a pair i have been using for 10 YEARS!!! they sound like a real headphone, and i paid 15 bucks
these are very cheap, and they sound like something you get from dollar store.
very disappointing Panasonic.
some PPL say oh well its 16 bucks,it shouldn't be that way, it's my hard earned money i dont give lightly.

author: M. Jiang
title: Wonderful surprise
content:
I purchased this for my mom for TV use, but what a wonderful surprise it is. Let me explain.

I have had many headphones for years, from high-end Grados to mid- and low-end Sennheisers. Full- or compact-size and earbuds, you name it, I have owned them all.

This Panasonic RP-HT21 has a similar sound signature to Panasonic RP-HTX-7, a very fashionable pair that cost 6 times more. The sound stage is quite good and its bass response mimic what I hear from my Grados. The mid-range is as smooth, if not smoother, than Sennheiser's PX90/100/200. The one point deduction comes from the high-pitch sound, where it just broke apart. Other than that, it is hard to believe that a five-buck headphone can sound this decent.

If radio/TV use is your primary reason when selecting headphones, look no further.

If you want a casual music listen experience, this will be a serious content. IMHO, this has all Sennheisers (excluding earbuds) PX and HD series headphones beat (below 60-dollar range).

As long as its build quality (all cheap plastic mind you) holds up, this gotta be the king of all budget headphones when cost and sound quality are put into equation.

One minor note though, the all plastic headband snatches my hair when adjusting. I rarely get this kind of treatment from other cans.

In the end, you cannot lose buying this little guy and you could be pleasantly surprised as I have been.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good product, worth the price
content: I bought my family this headphone as we often travel by plane. Works perfectly don't hurt your ear even for a 20+ hours flight, noise cancellation works well, clear sound. The foldable mode makes it easy to keep all in 1 pouch and save some space in my backpack! What's important is, our picky child loves it!

author: Tesla
title: Panasonic Headphones
content: These are amazing headphones, especially for the price. I switched to these after developing ear infections from my apple pods. I wasn’t expecting much with the price, but sound quality is amazing. I use this for music, movies, and video gaming and it works wonderful!! Just as great as $100+ headphones. Highly recommend these.

author: Michael D
title: Cheap brittle plastic
content:
Very poor quality plastic.  Bought 3 of these to use on a 1200 mile drive...  Only one pair made it there and none made it back.  The plastic is very brittle and snaps easily...

I purchased other inexpensive headphones at truck stops along the way and all of the replacements are still working...

I purchased these because of the Panasonic name thinking they would be better quality than a generic.  I was wrong.

author: Joseph R. Kennedy
title: and one of the first and best portable CD players
content: These headphones are the last of a dying breed.  In the mid-90s nearly all portable music devices came with a pair similar to these, and one of the first and best portable CD players, the Panasonic Mash, had a strikingly similar pair.  These were as close as I could come to getting a pair like that, and I was glad I hunted them down when I heard how good the sound was.  There were countless cheap replacement headphones released by companies like Memorex which seem to have left a lasting impression that headphones of this size and shape didn't sound good.  This pair is a good example of how wrong that idea is.  Headphones today seem to only come in earbud or full sized ear enclosing cups, and that's a shame.  Headphones like these were popular during the era when people would jog with a portable cassette player, and I feel the size helps that application.  Larger cups seem heavier and strain my neck after hours of such use.  These have zero sound isolation, but that was part of the design.  Don't get these for a recording studio.  They're great for listening to an mp3, however.

author: KittyCalamity
title: Great for the price!
content: Given the low price of these headphones, I didn't have very high expectations from them.  I bought them to use with my electric piano so my husband would be spared listening to me mutilate music.  They are great!  I actually like the tone of the piano better with them on than with them off, so that is a bonus!

author: Michelle
title: GREAT HEADPHONES
content: Amazing headphones!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! For the price these are spectacular. I was so surprised when I put them on, talk about an eargasm! I was skeptical about ordering them, but for the price why not? I was amazed when I put these babies on, and I got even better sound when I took off the ear coverings. They are lightweight, and you barely notice you have headphones on. I was wondering why these things have such amazing reviews now I know why. They are amazing! They have the best bass I have ever heard in cheap headphones, the sound is so clear, and crisp. I am extremely rough with headphones, I go through several headphones a month, but these things hold up nicely, they are really tough. They are better than all the headphones I have had in the 5-30 dollar range.This has been one of my best purchases, I have ever made, I am extremely pleased. And if they break I won't feel too bad because they're cheap. I will definitely be ordering more. I recommend these to any one who's on a budget and doesn't have the money to pay for expense headphones, these are the best cheap headphones around.

author: SPI-tv Media Group
title: RP-HT161 Headphones
content: I purchased two of these for our audio booth just for talent to be able to listen to engineer via intercom. They are low cost headphones and you get what you pay for, although I did not expect to get the quality of a $200 headphone, they work just fine with an as expected sound quality. We only use these for voice monitoring in a voice over booth and they work just fine for that purpose. The over the ear cups are pretty comfortable. The only real negative is that they DO NOT come with a 1/4 inch adapter if needed. I've never had headphones not come with that. But overall Im pleased with what we use these headphone units for as described.

author: tantan
title: Loved them at first but...
content:
Just got these in the mail today but they work great and are very light weight.  The sound is good as far as I am concerned and you can't beat the price!
That was my first pair.  The puppy chewed the cord after about a week (the cord is very thin) so I ordered a second set.  Within 2 days they stopped working!  I guess it is the jack.  I don't know what it is but there is no sound coming out of them.  I thought the price was too good to be true and it was!

author: Great Brit
title: Great for creating your own helmet drop ins !
content: My new Bern Ski Helmet came with some expensive drop ins that sounded awful. After some surfing I came across these budget pair of headphones which I selected with a goal to replacing my very poor helmet drop ins.  When worn as traditional headphone, they sound fair to good  but when they were under $13 it would be dumb to compare to my $300 plus headphones. A little thin but some discernible bass.  However, they have the features I need to use as drop ins i.e. an individual chord to each earpiece and a very simple attachment system. The earpieces can be detached from the headband in seconds by pushing the side arms outward and the soft earpieces can easily be removed with a little pressure as they are not glued and fit with elastic. As this point they can be inserted into my Bern helmet and the sound is really not too bad. it would be better if they sealed on your ear and some messing with the helmet chinstrap fixes this. They do however sound much much better than the relatively expensive drops ins that I bought with the helmet. Only downside is chord cannot be removed but at $13 total investment, I can live with it.

author: mr.cd
title: The sound is good!
content: I got these Panasonic headphones in the mail today. I bought these mainly for the good reviews + I wanted something light on my head for when I mow the lawn and listen to music on my iPod. I also have a beat up $8.00 KOSS UR/10 headphones I used for mowing the lawn, but the chord started coming apart from accidentally yanking it out of the iPod. The KOSS's sound was about the same as this Panasonic headset. I also have a more expensive headphone (Audio-technica ATH-M30), which I found out gets too hot on my head mowing the lawn. That now doesn't get used as much. To me, I think these cheaper headsets sound just as good as the Audio-tecnica over the whole ear headphone + your ears don't roast as much! For those of you that have a small head, these may be too big. My head is big and this set fits me just right. I didn't have to extend either side to fit over my ears. Actually, the bottom of each speaker fits exactly to the bottom of each of my earlobes. EDIT: After mowing the lawn, I found out these aren't very good at eliminating mower noise like the KOSS were.

author: Thomas L. Ballard
title: Good, but could be improved
content: I have not had these very long, but they are doing the job, which was to carry on the plane and do other little listening jobs here and there.. I carry a tablet, and these work very well for that.. I chose them mostly on the price point, not the sound quality.. My earlier model got broken, so I had to replace.. This is what I got.. I say could be better because it would be great if the ear piece would rotate enough to store more in a flat mode.. My earlier model did.. That was great for transporting.. Is this a big issue, no, but is great when I have it... So, for the money, this works.. At this price, it is just something to listen with. I listen to electronic books, so there is no need for high quality to do this.. I would buy these again, if I break these, or I would just buy whatever I found.. Not that big of a deal for what I do.

author: Chris W
title: Uncomfortable!
content: I tried them on and within a minute put them back in the box. The ear muffs are nit big enough for (I think) regular size ears. They are more precisely ON-ear headphones. Not what I was looking for. They don’t swivel along the vertical axis so pressure around the ears is uneven. And finally the headband is unpadded. Might be OK for someone with a full shock of hair, not for me with virtually no hair at all. Sound sounded OK so I’ll give one extra star.

author: Kay A. Valleskey
title: The headphones were purchased for use in our van. ...
content:
The headphones were purchased for use in our van. They survived heavy use by my grandchildren during their Christmas visit.
No complaints from the kids regarding quality of headphone sound. No complaints from the adults because the kids were quiet watching movies.
Win - Win.
UPDATE: I found the broken headphones in the van after the grandkids left. Disappointed in headphones and the kids.

author: MBT
title: Ok Quality - Great for Kids
content: You get what you pay for in electronics.  These are great for kids.  We some of the specializes kids on the ear headphones that work well and are much better quality than these but we could not hear anything the kids were watching on their iPads nor could they hear us.  This was a good compromise for us.  The sound for these when the kids wear them is not intrusive but yet we can still hear what they are listening to.  Plus the kids now hear us when they are wearing them which is a huge bonus.  I would definitely buy them again and I recommend others to consider these if you are looking to solve a similar issue just remember these are under $10 on the ear headphones and not audiophile or professional quality over the ear headphones.  If you are old enough to remember using the Sony Walkman cassette players then these are high quality compared to the earphones we used to use.

author: CarefulShopper1
title: Great Sound with Excellent Bass.  Very Comfortable and Fold Up Compactly.  A Superb Value!
content:
These wired earphones are a superb value.  They have excellent sound including good bass and good sound isolation.

They have a leather (or perhaps faux leather) padded ear cups that are very comfortable, even with extended use.  They have a volume control and long cord, and fold up very conveniently.

I purchased several different low-priced wired headphones at about the same time 18 months ago (these Panasonic Over-the-Ear Stereo Headphones RP-HT227, the Maxell HP-700F Foldable Digital Stereo Headphones, and the Panasonic On-Ear Stereo Headphones RP-HT21), and these have by far the best sound.

I personally prefer Bluetooth for convenience (I can personnally recommend the Kinovo BTH240), but if you need a wired earphone these are excellent and at around $15+ they are an excellent value.

author: Jason M
title: Decent for the price
content: For the price these are decent.  Biggest complaint is how loud I can hear them while they are being used.  Bought for my son so I didn't have to hear while he's on his Switch but I can hear everything clearly even though he's not listening to it unreasonably loudly.  The sound leaks out I guess

author: Martinex
title: You get what you pay for.
content: Come on.  You really didn't think you were going to get a quality set of headphones for 16 bucks, did you?  The biggest point of failure of wired headphones is to the connection between the wire and the speakers.  Even the most well-made units are not going to survive a cord snag or someone stepping on the cord.  Wireless headphones need constant recharging and pick up static during quiet moments.  So what's the solution?  A cheap pair of wired headphones.  Sure they're going to fail; probably faster than the expensive pair, but when they do you're only out a couple of bucks so who cares?  The trick with inexpensive headphones is to find a pair that has acceptable sound quality: Not great, just acceptable.  It's very possible to find cheap earbuds that meet this requirement.  Things start to get tricky when you graduate to over-ear units.  Unfortunately, the Panasonic RP-HT161-Ks miss the mark.  I can live with the higher frequencies which barely fall into the acceptable range.  Where these units fail are on the low end which is kind of weird.  Usually, the cheaper units provide muddy base and lack high-end response.  Sixteen bucks isn't a lot to pay for over the ear headphones but when you look at it from the standpoint that I'm probably never going to use them, it actually turns out to be fairly expensive.

author: MJ Smith
title: Good sound and for the cost these are unbeatable
content: Great headphones for the money.  They have good sound quality and for the money can't be beat.  Keep in mind, they do not fit snugly (at least for me) like more expensive headphones, so for travel in planes, etc, they will let in other sounds and people can hear them slightly.  But, the sound quality for listening to music is very good and for the price they are hands down hard to beat.  I use these for around home or travel, but if I want to really listen on a plane I take my more expensive Sony headphones, which have the cushioned ear pieces and really block out the jet engine noise far better for hearing the music.

author: Jeff
title: I was looking for a quick easy fix, and found it in these namebrand phones ...
content: Economic, lightweight quality.  What should one expect for headphones costing under six dollars? If your expectations are realistic, you will be pleasantly surprised with these. I was looking for a quick easy fix, and found it in these namebrand phones with prime shipping to my door in two days. I've used them for about a week. They are in fact very lightweight and comfortable. They fit firmly atop my ears (firmly enough not to slide or shake off requiring readjustment during normal use) and do not create any pressure points on the cartilage of my ear (3 to 5 hours average time per use). As to their sound quality (remember, six bucks) I'm quite pleased. I find the biggest difference is the source material, as much of what I'm listening to his web based – streaming music, YouTube, Netflix, Amazon prime video/music – and quality audio varies from clip to clip, let alone source. At six dollars, there was virtually no competition. Bargain bin, no name, knockoff earphones from Walmart, CVS, T.J. Maxx  (and the like) economy electronics' section are more expensive and hardly as reliable as Panasonic. Will I be lost in the experience as a blissful audiophile? NO WAY! Will I be able to hear what I'm listening to? No doubt! ... And that's the point

author: P. Adlparvar
title: Can't beat it for the price!! Really!!
content:
Read an audio mag review and figured can't lose for a few bucks.  Wow!  It really sounds great for what it is.  No comparison to my Sennheiser HD-580, but for the price, UNBELIEVABLE!  Better than most $20-30 headphones.  A true bargain even at 4x the price!!

One year follow-up review: I have had no problems, and even more, they keep sounding better. They actually are quite comfortable for long term listening (a movie on my computer) and seem to be better built than most. These headphones require an extended break-in. They definitely sound better now than new and their bass just keeps getting better. Still no comparison to my Sennheisers, but great for keeping with my computer or for a quick listen to something. The absolute best 'el-cheapo' headphones around! I've tried many and compared these to all my friends cheap headphones and these are more than just head and shoulders better! Well done Panasonic!

author: josh
title: Great for ipad or macbook (better than Sony MDRZX110 ZX)
content:
best low end headphones that i've found and i've tried a lot! my ten year old daughter is on her second pair. it took her about a year to wear out the cord on the first one which is pretty good since she uses the headphones for several hours a day. the sound is very good, you can easily resize the headband  from small to large and they fold well for travel. the analog volume control on the cable is a nice feature, too.

update 3/31/17: we also have a comparable pair of sony headphones MDRZX110 ZX. the sony's sound about the same are more stylish and fold flat. the min-iplug however, doesn't work well with our macbooks, they are a little less comfortable and there is no volume control.overall, we still like the panasonics.

we still love the headphones but the second pair died after about 3 months. i'm having them replaced under warranty. i would recommend spending the $2 for an extended warranty.

author: Radiologist in Richmond
title: Comparison of 4 Amazon Stereo Headphones
content:
Comparison of 4 Amazon Stereo Headphones:
I grew up using partial over the ear but this style is difficult to find these days.  I use the headphones when exercising, during yard work, or fix-up projects around the house.  I wear an extra large male hat size.
My favorite is the Maxell SL-3, hp-200.  I like the way they feel as they are the most comfortable of the group.  The sound is well balanced throughout the frequency range.  The over the ear component aligns with the middle of each earpiece so the angle feels good.  One potential drawback is that the cord is a straight plug connector as opposed to the firm rubber right angle plugs that are more common.  I remember having many of these straight connectors that eventually went bad at the connection.

My second favorite is the Sonxtronic XDR-8000.  These have ends that go into the ear.  They are comfortable.  These are lacking in the base and low frequency range and require a higher volume setting to achieve the same sound as the padded Maxell and Panasonic headphones reviewed. The sound is a bit “tinny”. I am keeping these because while they don’t sound the best, they don’t have the foam pads and thus will hold up much better for those times when I am sweating heavily.

My third favorite is the Panasonic RP=HT21.  These headphones have the overall best sound and have a very full stereophonic sound.  They have the best bass and low frequency sound.  They have a very good 90 degree connector plug.  The cord is a great length.  The problem is that they are narrow and sized for a person with a smaller, narrower head than mine.  Furthermore, the over the head portion attaches to the earpiece at its front section.  This design causes the earpiece to flare away from the back of the ear and the sound suffers.  If you hold the earpieces to your ears with your hands the sound improves significantly.  In addition, this design results in a pinching effect that is very uncomfortable.  If the headpiece connected to the mid point of the earpiece I believe the problems would be solved and this would jump to the #1 favorite position.  At the price I am willing to keep them and see if they become more comfortable with time, but I am very doubtful.

Totally unacceptable is the Sony MDR-A17G.  Although they say Sony on the item, I doubt they are really made by Sony.  The earpiece quality is terrible and had extra plastic that scratches the ear.  The overall quality looks very cheap.  The sound is terrible, with a very tinny sound and no bass.  These will be returned.

author: dejected yeti
title: Great for back-to-school lists
content:
As media becomes more of a staple of our education system headphones are as common as crayola on our back to school lists. I bought these for our girls K and 2nd grade supply lists because of the great price an reviews. Unbelievably, these headphones made it through an entire year of school and have followed our girls into 1st and 3rd grade! If somehow they make it another year I will update this review but we are blown away by how durable these phones are.

Pros
+ Unbelievably durable, it they can survive a year with a kindergartener they can survive anything
+ Sound is great for the price. Of course there are far better sounding headphones, but at less than $5 the sound is a real achievement
+ Crazy good value
+ Good surface area on top of band perfect for a name label

Cons?
- If the price climbs to $10 then I will try to come up with a con, but at this price, I can't fault these phones at all

These are great phones for the price and perfect for kids, I highly recommend them as do hundreds of other satisfied reviewers

author: Victoria
title: Great headphones for open air over the head 80’s style
content: I put these babies on and instantly i was trasported back to the 80’s! These woulda been top of the line headphones back then. Heck i prob woulda bought two pair back tgen just in case i sat on one while riding the bus listening to crue or misfits on the schoolbus. Speaking of which if anybody sees steve... tell him he still owes me a copy of ziggy stardust and the spiders from mars. Thanks.

author: random wanderer
title: Good for the price
content:
These headphones are good for the price you pay, but they will fail within 3 to 6 months depending on how you use them.  I've gone through almost a dozen pair over the past 3 or 4 years, and inevitably the wire (near where the plug connector is) will degrade inside the plastic sleeve, and suddenly one of the earpieces won't work. Your stereo music is suddenly mono.  You can wiggle the wire around a bit to make a temporary connection, but as soon as you let go you're back to mono.

So why do I give this 4 stars when it fails like that? Because every other headphone I've tried is worse. I haven't found a Bluetooth headphone that works without beeping between songs or other problems I won't bore you with. I haven't found an over-the-ear headphone that was ever comfortable for more than 10 minutes, which is because of the shape of my ears.  This on-the-ear set sits on the center of my ear comfortably because the earpads rotate; it has good sound for the period that it works; it doesn't block out other sounds around me which is what I want 90% of the time; and it's cheap enough so I can buy them half a dozen at a time and thus have a new pair ready when the last pair fails.

These are cheap headphones, but I haven't found anything that works better for me than this.

author: David F
title: Great build quality, comfortable, decent sound quality
content:
The build quality on these headphones is fantastic, and they are very comfortable over the ears. The extra long cable is a great feature that you don't realize how nice it is until you have it. They sound pretty good, but not great. I'd say they sound almost as good as the old pair of Sony MDRZX100 headphones I had for a few years, and not nearly as good as the Koss UR40s I borrowed from a friend for a week.

If you're not a huge snob about sound, or if build quality and/or long cable are important, than these are great headphones for the price, otherwise I recommend the Koss UR40.

author: McDork
title: Exceeds my expectations
content:
I have a couple pairs of more expensive 'over the ear' headphones, they sound good but are heavy, have long cords (when I only need about 2 feet), and are large bowl shapes on each ear.  What I wanted was something small to use with my Chromebook in my lap that sounded Ok and wasn't blasting sound into the room.

These Panasonic, on ear, headphones meet most of my guidelines.  They are much lighter, the cord is shorter but I wish it was shorter still; a single cord from only 1 of the ears would be a bit more convenient and less tangle prone.  Each ear's speaker is much smaller too so I don't feel like it's bumping into my chair or pillow when I turn my head.  The sound is actually very good for listening to youtube and streaming shows.  I also appreciate it has a right angle plug so it doesn't stick straight out the side of my Chromebook risking a serious breakage; that's a nice touch.

I've only had these for about 30 minutes so I have no comments on reliability; if things go bad I'll update this review.  In the meantime, I'm a satisfied customer and I only spent about 5-10% of what my 'quality' phones cost.

author: The Spunkster
title: Decent..But didn't knock my socks off
content: I have been using JVC Flats and Panasonic earbuds for years.  After reading a ton of reviews I decided to pick up a pair of Panasonic on ear headphones.  They sound decent and play louder than my Flats before distorting.  However they lack 'pop' compared to them and are not as comfortable.  For the price they are all right.  I gave the m to my son and he appreciates them

author: InTents
title: Good value, but why so tight?
content: Just wanted some inexpensive knock-around headphones with decent sound, and these are that. But why did they make the headband so tight? Maybe they were thinking of joggers; they won't fall off. They wouldn't fall off a 6 year old on a trampoline! But for home use, it feels like my head is in a vise. OK, I'm exaggerating. Nonetheless, I would buy them again.

author: 1mamaj
title: Comfortable and sound great!
content: I love the comfort of these!!! I have had several different types of the bud earphones and they are not comfortable to me. I am not using these for any type of exercise, I am just trying to watch Netflix and Amazon movies. These work so good for amplifying the voice over the background music and are so comfortable to wear. I was constantly having to put the bud type back into my ear, they just wouldn't stay in. Then, when I finished my movie, my ears were sore from pushing them in so much. These Panasonics are PERFECT! I bought 2 so that I could leave a pair at our cabin and leave a pair home. Now I am going to get another pair and leave in the car!

author: Tom K.
title: I don't know how you can do better. Sure there are better headphones out there
content:
I give this 5 stars because for $7.95 and free shipping, I don't know how you can do better. Sure there are better headphones out there, but not at this price. I know, I have bought several sub $10 headphones over the years, these are the best in both sound quality and comfort.

If you are a heavy user of headphones and really want to enjoy quality sound sound and comfort, I would go for a more expensive set, but for a occasional user such as myself, these will make you happy.

Don't get me wrong, the bass and treble is quite good, but there are not going to match up with the sound of quality of headphones such as my old but still good over the ear Sony headphones. I guess what I'm trying to say is for $7.95, these are a diamond in the rough.

I will mention that on one of my old radios, if I push the plug in all the way, only one side works. I found if I pull the plug out slightly, both sides work.Not sure if this is the headphones plug problem, or the old radio.

author: S. W.
title: Decent cheap headphones; run narrow
content:
So, I was looking for a replacement for my old Sony lightweight headphones, which they no longer make. I just need something so no one else has to hear what I'm listening to, so I'm not comparing these to over-the-ear, noise cancelling, studio-quality headphones; I'm really only comparing them to the ten-dollar-ish Sony's I had previously.

For what they are, they're fine. I can enjoy music or a video, and it sounds good.

The downside of these is that the hard plastic part of the headband is shaped for a narrower head than mine (and my head is pretty wide), so they are not as comfortable as the ones I am replacing.

author: AR
title: Misleading Product Title. Not ∙∙∙Over-The-Ear∙∙∙ Headphones.
content:
The title of this item is misleading. The headphones are ∙∙∙On-Ear∙∙∙ Headphones, not OVER-THE-EAR. The only reason I got these headphones is because I wanted over-the-ear. I have some very low-end (~$10) over-the-ear, Bluetooth headphones, and the sound quality is way better than these.

To: Amazon. On a separate note, the headphones box was completely open upon arrival. The cable was coiled back inside the box as if a child had tried putting them back in.

author: Royalecheese2001
title: You get what you pay for
content:
They work, which is all that can reasonably be expected when you pay $6 for headphones.

There is no volume control, so these are not headphones you want to use with a computer.
The quality of the product is acceptable, but hardly comfortable for more than 10-20 minutes at a time.
The cord is pretty flimsy, but as yet unknown if it will stand up to use.

I purchased these to use on my computer at work so I could listen to voicemail, and occasionally watch something online. Unless you are buying these for a child, and you do not care if they get torn up because of the cost, do yourself a favor and order something a bit more substantial with better padding, volume control, and maybe a longer cord. I guarantee you will be happier spending another $10-$20 for a better product. I just wish I had.

author: Thom J.
title: Budget function, comfort and reliability.
content:
They cost me about 5 dollars including shipping. Considering cost they are excellent. They are lightweight, do not overly fatigue my ears and have nice stereo sound. I've been using them constantly at my desk for about a month now and can vouch for their reliability. The audio quality is not super great at high volume and there seems to be exaggerated loss in quality with high highs and low lows. Then again you aren't buying these for that.

I do not use them outdoors or with portable electronics so I couldn't tell you much on that.

There was a little static when I rotated the jack. I noticed this when I first got them. But stopped looking for it and haven't noticed it since.

Look for an open box deal on these, they're legit.

author: Y. Pope
title: Good Enough hg
content: These are nice headphones, I use for meditation and watching movies on my laptop. They don't completely cancel out all noise, but you can hear clearly the show you're watching even if there are some other sounds outside or around you.  I can still focus on what I'm doing and remain aware of what is going on outside of my place.

author: Connie Bedwell
title: Works great for my purposes
content:
My stereo speakers started hissing badly, and this bypasses them. With an extension cord, I can again relax on the couch and enjoy music.
Also, at one time my neighbor started playing loud music with heavy bass  off and on all day for 3 weeks (before I reported him to management). The headset muffled it somewhat, but I had to resort to earplugs due to the bass, and I was afraid I'd sleep thru my alarm. I was able to hook headset into my phone, and heard the alarm even with my earplugs

author: TC
title: Sounds great, but not very comfortable
content:
I have had this for about a month now and got them for $14.75 total. So far no problems with anything.

I really like how it folds up and can get very compact and also the cord is not very long so it doesn't get tangled up. You would need to buy an extension cord if you wanted to sit in bed and watch TV with it though.

The sound quality seems great to me. The highs and midtones are very clear and come through well, but the bass is also full toned and strong. I listen to a lot of jazz and blues and these work great for them.

They don't seem to have much of a noise canceling quality, though that doesn't bother me as I can easily tune out background noises.

The build quality does seem a little cheap, but I haven't had any problems so far as others have. I've also dropped mine a few times and they've taken a couple of hard bumps and were fine, so maybe it's just luck of the draw with that.

The big negative though is comfort. I bought these thinking the ear pad was going to be pretty big and fit around my ears and they don't also, they aren't very soft. It starts making my ears sore after an hour or so. It might force me to get a new pair of headphones eventually. But for now, for less than $15 this is one heck of a deal.

author: Da Bunkster
title: Tiny, More Like “On The Ear” Headphones
content: These headphones sound good when you consider the price. Unfortunately, I’ll be sending them back because I wanted them for at work because I work in an open office space and they’re small. If you’re looking for over the ear, these are not that because they barely cover my ears. No, I’m not Dumbo...

author: missability
title: Lasted 8 months
content: Well, I didn't pay much, so not sure I have the right to complain, but more than 8 months would have been nice. The right ear foam cover started coming off after 3 months, not a deal-breaker, but definitely a pain in the ----..but after 8 months  the left ear speaker was completely gone... went out....guess I'll go start a search for another pair...sigh...

author: th3thirdman
title: Cord way too short
content:
The sound quality is good for the price. The headphones themselves are comfortable and fit securely. The cord is why I rated this four and not five stars. One, it's short. It was clearly meant for portable devices only, as it reaches to my phone in my pocket with only a little slack to spare (I suppose I should have realized this before buying since it says right on the product description). Two, the plug does not fit securely into audio jacks. It's pretty easy to accidentally loosen to the point where it is still inside the jack but does not transmit audio. I bought this hoping to use it both for portable music and my desktop computer. I have only found it useful for the former.

UPDATE 27 DECEMBER 2016:

Okay. I've had this pair for a little while now. I still can't understand why the cord would be so short. I can barely use this thing. The only way I can use it without the jack repeatedly coming out of my phone is if it's in my shirt pocket, and I don't like to do that because my phone might fall out when I bend down. I definitely can't use it for my computer because my head would need to be too close. It's good for maybe watching a movie on your phone. I've changed my rating to 3 stars down from 4 because of this. It seems to be of good quality other than the cord, which is long enough for perhaps a child or infant.

UPDATE 17 JUNE 2017:

This pair's giving out. Right ear's coming in and out. Starting two months ago the plastic tabs holding each side to the frame started to break off, causing the adjustable parts to slide freely. Still not terrible headphones for the price. They've lasted 7 months.

author: Alex K
title: Great deal
content: These sound great and really comfortable. Excellent bass. I put in my old cheap earbuds after listening to these and laughed at the difference, the earbuds were so tinny. They don't go super loud though. It was a problem when trying to listen to a low sound audio book while driving my loud diesel truck but only that one time. I have other headphones that do go louder (Audio Technica ATH-M50) and sometimes I will start using them and not realize my phone is at 100% volume and it will blast my eardrums. These Panasonics won't do that. Really a good deal, for the price especially.

author: Meagan Ammons
title: Best idea ever
content: After wasting my money on many other character headphones for my 4 year old son I decided I would buy a cheap pair.  Best idea ever!  He has used for over a month now and he is very rough on them with his ipad.  He pulls drops and stretches and they are still going strong.  I will buy again!

author: J. Blair
title: Very uncomfortable
content:
The good:
They work well and I'm glad I only purchased them for $10.

The bad:
They are extremely uncomfortable to wear. They are not shaped for a human head and would probably fit a box better. I hate wearing them, but fortunately I'm only using them for 30 minutes or so at a time. In addition to being uncomfortable they are surprisingly heavy. Not worth returning, but certainly a poorly made product.

author: Brian Foster
title: I love these headphones
content:
5 stars based on price/performance ratio.

These are not the best sounding headphones, but for this price, they sound really good.  Prior to finding this model I have been buying the Koss KTX-Pro 1.  I liked the sound of the Koss but always found them lacking in bass and sometimes highs.  Worse of all, the Koss would always break because that stupid in-line volume control (what a bad idea) would always go bad.

So I needed something cheap to knock around while using my mp3 player when I'm out cycling or rollerskating.

I found these Panasonic headphones are was very impressed.  The bass on these is fantastic.  The highs are decent and the mids are good.  Don't buy these expecting the world, but you will get a good budget product.
I was so impressed that I bought three pairs.

I have found them to be very durable.  I have accidentally yanked on the cord so many times, the Koss would have been dead way sooner, but these Panasonics keep on going .  In just a day, I will have been using the same pair for two years and only recently did they start to get some signal loss due to loose wiring.

For affordable headphones, $5.99 at the time of this review, that is an impressive lifespan, especially as they were used on almost a daily basis and not always with the greatest care.

I plan on buying more of these because you never know when a good product is going to disappear.

author: Amazon1 Customer
title: Great Headphones!!!!!
content:
I bought these 3 months ago so I can listen to music while I'm at work, using my computer there. I did not want an expensive set of head phones, (they might "walk away"), so this was a good buy. I figured I could go through 10 sets at $5 a set, and it would be worth it, even if each set didn't hold up very long - compared to having a $50 set for 1 week, then they disappear into thin air.

I've used the earbuds for awhile, (about 4 yrs) and they're OK, about $8 a set in the grocery store, sound quality decent, but they wear out after a few months (not surprising).  My only real complaint with the earbuds was every time I fixed them comfortably in my ears, someone would come up to me for something, and I'd have to take them out and then spend 5 minutes trying to get them comfortable again!

So I looked around for headphones, thinking at least I could just pop them on and off.

VERY SURPRISED!!!!!!! and pleased at how 1) comfortable; 2) excellent fit (usually after 3 months the headpiece has stretched out on every pair, cheap or expensive, I have ever owned, and they're too loose;  3) truly great sound quality and 4) durable.  I'm hard on everything.  They're still working fine.

Both speakers are working perfectly. True stereo.

I have very good hearing - I can hear someone using a stapler 3 work areas away with no trouble - that's why I need the headphones.

The sound quality on these little gems is so good, I can actually hear the singer sometimes pause and inhale before starting another line.  NEVER heard that with any headphones before.

I'm ordering 3 more sets for our home computers.

Can't pass them up!

author: Julie
title: Fine for talking on the phone -- but not for listening to music
content: Okay... but not good for listening to music.  The bass is not good.  I have a very old cheap JVC headset and the bass quality is so much better.  I tried this one because the reviews on the same style JVC handsets were not that good so I thought the quality may have gone down.  Again, these are fine for hands free talking on the phone, but not for music.

author: Paperclips
title: For a while it was like all you could find were expensive noise cancelling headphones ...
content: For a while it was like all you could find were expensive noise cancelling headphones or earbuds. My noise cancelling headphones are great for mowing the lawn, but can get sweaty and always need batteries. As far as earbuds my ears do not like them, they either fall out or the ones that stay in hurt my ears. So I went on the hunt for some classic headphone like the ones I grew up with & I found them! These are perfect! I wear them working in the garden/yard and when just sitting outside. I also use these for running as I like to listen to music but also want to be able to be aware of what is around me, like a car coming up behind me. For the price these headphones a re surprisingly good. I've had mine for over a year now and they are still in great shape. I would highly recommend!

author: Parisjoy
title: Super sound at a great price!
content: These are great little headphones for so cheap a price!! I really was blown away by the sound they provide, and how light and comfortable they are. Now I'm no audiophile, so I can't compare these to some super high end product, I probably wouldn't be able to tell the difference. So I'm speaking as a person who just like to listen to music and knows very little about the high end stuff. To me, as an ordinary listener, these are really great sounding, they are not noise cancelling so you can still hear stuff going on around you if you don't have the music turned up really high, which I like, but some people may not. I can't believe how little these cost and how great the sound seems to me, I was so happy with my purchase. I would recommend these to anyone who is looking for a good value, I'm very pleased.

author: KS
title: So comfy!
content: I've had these (over-the-ear version) for a few months now and you just can't beat the comfort and quality for this price. Most headphones are either uncomfortably tight to me, or pull on my hair, sometimes both! These are light as a feather and I've worn them for hours and hours with zero problems. Sound quality is very good for this price point--they isolate noise way more than ear buds. I've had my music cranked up and coworkers had to tap me on the shoulder to get my attention because I couldn't hear them walk up. You'll have to spend a few more bucks if you want headphones that cancel all ambient noise, though. I'm buying my second pair today so I can enjoy them at home as well as work.

author: Mike in Elmhurst
title: Very nice for the price!
content: I actually was surprised with these headphones. I bought them for a portable DVD player I like to watch when in bed. I appreciate that it has a volume control as my hearing fluctuates due to air-pressure/allergy problems. The sound is very clear, the bass effects are good, and overall they're very comfortable to wear. I recommend them!

author: N.. Martin
title: Excellent value, comfort, sound, and problematic jack
content: Excellent sound at this price point, and far superior to buds which cost 20 times as much. (Oh, but not nearly as cool.) Very comfortable. I dock it a star for the jack, which is thick and inconvenient for many current devices, and even when fully inserted makes a crackling sound when turned. However, in use this is not a problem with the iPhone is use which has a thin case. There are bound to be many cases with which this jack will not work.

author: SuperTechX
title: Decent Cheap Lightweight Headphones (Over The Ear Model)
content:
These are decent cheap headphones.  I already own the On Ear Model and can vouch for them being great for a few reasons, especially with some EQ modding.  I have assumed that the same 30mm drivers were used in both.  However, these headphones seem to be distinctly worse in several ways. I was expecting the same or better performance out of the box but got disappointment instead.  They are lightweight, but not quite comfortable.  The top bands seem designed to dig into the top of your head.  The ear pads are soft and comfy, but the real problem is the sound quality.  I got these as a backup set for several purposes, but I just could not stand the muffled quality to the sounds.  The main problem stems from the black fiber "pad" over the actual driver.  I cut these away with ease and the muffled quality went with them.  The circular bumps are the plastic casing over the drivers.  The pad is to stop liquid entry but the cost is to high for me.  Here is an EQ Mod that made them tolerable for me.  125Hz: +5, 250Hz: +1, 500Hz: 0, 1kHz : +1, 2kHz : +1, 4kHz : +3, 8kHz : +4, 16kHz: +4
YMMV.
You can hear A LOT of outside sound with these.  Only a little bit more isolation than the On Ears.
I still recommend the On Ear over this.

author: Sunny
title: Inexpensive, decent sounding headphones
content:
Let me start by saying that these are my favorite style of headphones. I find ear-buds to be uncomfortable, and the sound to be of poor quality (no bass whatsoever and low quality high notes). The big ear-muff style headphones sound great, but I don't like how they look on me, nor do I like the fact that you can't hear any other noises (like someone trying to get your attention). They are also not really as good for wearing while doing something physical, such as jogging, and they are too big to be able to have them on while your head is sideways on a pillow or a chair, etc.

But this style of headphones is a nice compromise right in the middle.

In my experience for a couple months of frequent use of these headphones, with all kinds of music and audio, I have found them to sound very decent. Compared to other brands and models of this style of headphones that I have owned, these have a very decent amount of bass in them, significantly more so than my last pair, and the high notes also sound nice and clear. They fit well on my head too. For what they are, they do a very decent job.

author: Nashoba Losa
title: Nice inexpensive headphones
content: My old headphones quit working on the left side so I decided to get some new ones.  These new ones are so much better than the old ones even before the left side died that it is difficult to make a meaningful comparison.  I like the sound qualith and the response to increased and decreased sound adjusted through my laptop.  I don't there is much noise cancellation as there is no ambient sound around me when I am listening to stuff on my computer.  I'd buy these again, though.

author: Nicole at Work
title: Mediocre All Around
content: I bought these for the long cord... I didn't realize that the sound quality would be so inferior.  I'm not looking for super cool DJ headphones or anything, just headphones for work.  I unplugged my current headphones with a shorter cord (that I was hoping to replace) and plugged these Panasonic ones in.  I was SHOCKED at how much quieter the music was on these Panasonics compared to my current (similarly styled, over the ear) headphones.  The Panasonic DO NOT have a good quality and feel of the plastic… feels cheap, easy to crack.  I will be sticking with my shorter cord headphones that work wonderfully.  They are also from Amazon - Model:  Ailihen I35 Stereo Lightweight Foldable Headphones. https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B015WBVJDI/ref=oh_aui_search_detailpage?ie=UTF8&psc=1

author: JWB
title: Great choice for most users, inexpensive, loud, comfortable
content:
I bought my first pair of these for full price of $5.95 in December of 2013 and have never accepted discounted products. My rating criteria is as follows. If the product works as is advertised and the quality is in line with the price then I give it five stars tentatively, then deduct stars for usability problems, functionality problems, flaws, quality, etc.

I've actually bought many pairs of these headphones for myself and others, and all have been of very high initial quality, and of good durability, with the price ranging up to $12 and back down to around $7.

Its hard to evaluate sound quality, and I have never had the desire or cash to spend more than $25 on headphones.  But for the price I have been very happy--I've never said to myself, "I wish these were louder," or "I wish these sounded different," or anything else like that.  I guess my thought is that if you know enough to critically evaluate a pair of headphones beyond those two questions, you probably wouldn't buy them on the Internet where you can't listen first.  I've bought a couple other pairs of sub-$10 headphones for my wife and kids, and these are the loudest, best and longest lasting, but they insist on earbud style so they haven't switched to these full time.

I don't like in-ear headphones because they tend to fall out of me ears, and eventually just get uncomfortable after an hour or so.  I guess I have a sensitive head, because I have quit using other headphones before because they squeeze too hard or the foam doesn't do its job.  These are comfortable enough for me that I can watch a movie on an airplane without discomfort.

For a decent pair of headphones, you won't go wrong here.  There may be better choices, but after listening to a couple other pairs that my family uses, if I needed a new pair of headphones I wouldn't even look at anything else.

As for durability, these have been very good for me.  I'm not a person who uses headphones multiple times per day, so I can't comment on how durable they are with constant, heavy use.

author: D.M.
title: Don't expect much...
content: I needed a cheap pair of headphones with a long cord, and that's exactly what these are.  They DO NOT fit snugly to your head, so there's no real noise reduction.  They're really lightweight, so you can wear them long periods without fatigue.  If you're looking to hear sound in your ears, these are fine (as long as you're also okay with everyone else around you listening along).  If you're hoping to actually listen to music, spend a little more and get a better pair.

author: Capt. Aero
title: Small But Powerful, They Have Exceptional Tonal Range
content: And they stay put on your head. Outside sounds can penetrate, which is good for survival. I wish I'd had these decades ago. They will be great for monitoring video shooting. I've been testing them on Bernie Nee's and Paul Robert's, "The Blob" and Brasil '66 with, "The Fool on the Hill". But in fact, everything sounds better with these, proving again that you can't buy quality with lots of money, but rather, you have to hunt and find it. Don't be misled by the low price. I'm tempted to buy a 20-pack of these and gift them to my friends (not telling them how inexpensive they are).

author: BGee
title: Good sound and good price
content:
I have tried several different brand headphones, Audio-Technica ATH-M30, Sennheiser HD 238, Panasonic RP-HTF600-S, Sony MDRPQ2, Monster NCredible NTune.
The sound quality from the best to worst is:
Audio-Technica ATH-M30 - $40
Panasonic RP-HT21 - $8 This product
Monster NCredible NTune - $50
Sennheiser HD 238 - $30
Panasonic RP-HTF600-S -$30
Sony MDRPQ2 - $30

The long hour wearing comfortable ranking is:
Panasonic RP-HT21 - This product
Audio-Technica ATH-M30
Sennheiser HD 238
Panasonic RP-HTF600-S
Monster NCredible NTune
Sony MDRPQ2

I have bought the second one for my wife to watching video and listening to musing on computer. The only trick is you need to turn the volume up a little more than other small headphone or earphone.

author: M. Alexander
title: Excellent Price.....Above Average Sound
content:
I am no audiophile and i am came to these after my $20 single-sided cord, JWIN headphones, started giving trouble after 4 yrs. (wish I could have told you which model but it has worn of)
After listening to these on my laptop for a couple of hours I have to say that out of the box, the mid to high frequencies are boosted way too much for my liking (vocals and percussion stand out and overpower the bass). I have used the equalizer in winamp to reduce the harshness of the frequencies a bit and it sounds better.
That being said audio source has a big part to play, so i can't say how these will sound on a portable audio device with limited equalizer abilities.
Other things to note are that its kinda small(30mm driver), its very light, and cables are kinda thin.

Bottom line for 5 bucks....you would be hard pressed to find better

but if you need better i would advise anything with at least 40mm drivers that cost at least 15 dollars with a single-sided cord.

author: Al Nelson
title: Great for Games
content: I use more expensive headphones for production tasks, but when I kick back to play games, these are my go-to cans. They are light and painless for long play sessions, but they stay put. The sound is surprising clean and clear, with a meaty low-end bump, that makes guns and explosions sound good. They definitely punch above their weight class.

author: MishaM
title: Didn't work out of the box. Twice.
content: I ordered this headset because of the good reviews. I got it and tried to use it - it didn't work. The jack had to be moved around to get all kinds of levels of sound, and then it's either the voices disappeared and the music stayed or the background noise is all that was heard. I decided to return the headset and try a replacement (again, such good reviews, I must have received a defective one). Here comes the second set, and out of the box - the same identical problem. To get some level of sound I had to play around with the jack, pull it out slightly, turn it around, and then the sound would break at the first movement. I'm returning this one also and will never order again. Just for reference, I own a set of Inland headphones with microphone and sound adjustment, and the jack is identical. It works superbly on my laptop.

author: Bruce Ewing
title: Very nice headphones
content: I specifically wanted on-ear, corded headphones. After sorting out all the ones that didn't match those two specs -- these headphones were the clear choice on price. They have exceeded my expectations. The bass response really is unusually good, and the headphones and cord appear to be heavier duty and higher quality than I was expecting. The fit is firm, but quite comfortable.

author: Count Orloff
title: cheap, excellent bass, but poor sound for music
content:
I needed a very inexpensive over-ear headphone set for my 5 year old to use at school computer lab. This works well for that. At five samoleans how can you go wrong? And the headband design is easy for him to put on and fits his head okay. But personally as an adult I would not want to use these for music. Overall they sound quite poor, especially on fine acoustic or classical music. Though on lighter fare like pop music, the bass is surprising strong and pleasant. I'm not sure how the bass can be so wonderful, yet the overall fidelity sound like a tinny AM radio. I could probably use these for tasks or as a study aid, like for spoken language lessons, audio books, transcription, listening to lecture recordings - I guess anything but good music.

If you need something cheap and easy to take on and off, and fine to throw in your bag and not worry about losing, these are for you. If you want decent sound, not really.

author: SeekSanity
title: Fills the purpose well
content: I bought the on-ear style. This is the "old school" style headphone I prefer for outside running for several reasons. They are comfortable which is key and what really impressed me immediately was the strong bass. Great for my music selections. Can't comment on durability and expectations aren't high on that given they're used for running, but if they last a decent amount of time I'd purchase again

author: Shawn P Fahy
title: Great sound, low price.
content:
I am not only a Luddite, but I'm also cheap.  I don't understand much about new technology and I don't want to pay a lot for it either.  I bought these earphones because of their price and their good rating and I'm here to tell you that I wish I'd bought them long ago!  They cost about the same as the cheap headphones from the local big-box store but the sound quality is obviously better.  The bass especially is very strong, which might be important to you depending on what you're listening to.

I only gave these four stars instead of five because the fit is tighter than I'd like; I have a very large head and so wearing them for a long time could become uncomfortable.  If you have a normal-sized noggin then this might not be an issue though.

author: HWC
title: Good quality, light weight
content: Arrived in a seal plastic/paper wrapping. Good quality, light weight. Fit adult head just fine. It's not the kind that will squeeze into your head. There is not much bass. I figure this is good for dictation, phone conversation or young children. So I will keep it. If you want something for music with more lively sound, go with other kind like Amazon basic headphone. This one does have a volume control on the cable which is nice.

author: Veeman
title: Excellent low budget headphones with great fidelity!
content: I'm impressed by the sound quality of these inexpensive headphones.  They are light years better than most earbuds.  I leave them at work and if they suddenly disappear, I won't fret too much.  If I left my Senheisers and they disappeared, that'd be a different story.  I would call myself an audiophile.  I rip all music to lossless format.  I like to hear all the nuances within songs.  These are perfect low budget work headphones that sound great and are comfortable for hours of listening pleasure.

author: Jason
title: Short cord, short plug.
content: On the plus side, they fit comfortable on my head while I'm wearing glasses, and the sound quality seems okay.  On the neg side, the cord is too short for me to plug into my computer head phone jack, and the plug itself is too short for me to use with my phone, because of the phone case.  The phone case is pretty thin, and other headphone plugs work fine with it.

author: Farmer Sam
title: Decent headphones for the price
content: I wasn't expecting top of the line headphones, nor did I want to pay for top of the line.  These fill the bill just fine for me at the price I wanted to pay.  The sound isn't the best and the ear pieces don't swivel, so the way they fit your head is the way they fit with no adjustment other than the band at the top that lets you adjust the length like on most headsets.  I've always gotten good service out of Panasonic products, though, and expect no different from these.  They're decent headphones and I'd recommend them.

author: Amazon Customer
title: OK
content: I bought these to replace some Amazon Basics headphones I had. These are OK. They don't fit as well as my Amazon headphones. For some reason, it feels like there is too much space in the earphone cups and they are loose. Also, they aren't as loud so you have to turn the volume up. Overall, they seem to work fine and are pretty decent for the money, but I wouldn't call them the best headphones I've ever had.

author: jimbo
title: Good Price, Light and Portable. Mushy Sound
content:
These headphones are light, portable, fold up into a small package, and are relatively comfortable.  The price is very good if you need a pair of phones to go with your MP3 player and don't have a lot of extra cash.  I use them with my MP3 player when I'm flying or working out, i.e., situations where I'm not too concerned with the sound quality. They are very light and a little delicate so you have to handle with care.

The sound quality is just okay. They have "extra bass boost", which could also be called "extra mushy" or "extra muddy".  These are probably okay for certain genres of music like hip hop and rap, where the bass beat seems to be the whole point.  And they are fine for audio books or podcasts where sound fidelity is not crucial, but if you want to listen to music with any resemblance to the original source, these are not going to hack it. I have experimented with a multitude of EQ settings to even out the bass, and "un mushify" the sound, but it doesn't help much.  If you want lots of bass and aren't picky about the overall sound quality, these will work fine and are a good deal. If you want better than mediocre sound quality across the spectrum, you need to spend a few more bucks and keep looking.

author: John Arthur Lee (fiction writer)
title: Great sound and quality for the price. A bit tight, so I stretch them.
content:
I wanted something lightweight and inexpensive that I could use at my desk for hours at a time, yet something that wouldn't break in two weeks. And so far, these headphones have performed very well for me.

They sound great--more bass than expected--and the ear cushions are good enough. My only complaint is that the headband applies more pressure than I would prefer (and I don't have a large head). So when I'm not using them, I wrap them around a medium ball and it stretches them out a bit (see photo).

author: The Book Hoarder
title: Perfectly good headphones
content: I wanted just normal headphones without any b.s. that I could use with my stereo at home.  All Target had were Bluetooth ones, or ones for little kids.  When I tried to explain what I wanted to the clerk, he seemed to not understand what I was talking about: "headphones you can plug into a headphone jack."  Anyway, I gave up and just got these on Amazon.  They're fine.

author: S. Tomlin
title: Avoid these headphones..
content: Four months, that is all we got out of them. My son only used them in the house and the headphones have failed. I understand they are nowhere near the top of the line, but this is ridiculous.

author: M. Belli
title: Fits my small head (most adult hats do not).  The ear pads might be small for large ears.
content:
When not telescoped, the over-head band fits me almost perfectly, even tho' most adult hats and earphones do not.
However, the padded ear covers are not large in diameter and might be small for some people.

My audio testing has been limited to use with an electronic drum kit, so I can't comment on the audio quality.
I don't think these are intended to be noise cancelling.

author: Stair Climber
title: Very Lightweight.  Comfortable.  Inexpensive.  No bass.  No sound isolation.
content: Some people complain that the wiring breaks.  So far so good with mine.  I've been getting frequent ear infections so I'm switching from using ear buds to these lightweight on-ear headphones when listening to instructional videos at work.  For this low price don't expect high end sound but they are quite suitable for voice or low volume background music.  If you are looking for headphones that provide good sound isolation from external noises look elsewhere.  If they last me a year and break, at this price I'll just buy another pair.

author: James D.
title: Hanging tough after two months with toddler
content:
Bought these headphones for my kids to use in the backseat when watching their movies.  The car came with bluetooth headphones that my son destroyed.  Instead of buying the car manufacturer's headphones, I decided to go cheaper and buy the wired kind.  I figured if my son breaks these, I would not worry about replacing them since they are so cheap.
These headphones exceeded my expectations.  I thought they would be broken within the first week.  They are still going strong after two months.  My son loves these headphones and they are a perfect fit for his little 3 year old head.  Since they are wired, my son does not throw these around like he did the previous pair.  He is careful with them and the headphones are lasting.  The best part is that if he does break them, it won't hurt my wallet to replace them.

author: Jeff F
title: Decent Sound But Not Very Comfortable
content:
These headphones are not terrible especially considering the price. The sound quality is OK but as good as more expensive headphones. My biggest issue is comfort. These are not very comfortable and cant really be adjusted to fit on your ears . They are very stiff but again for this price you can't complain too much.
I would instead recommend the SONY MDR-G45LP headphones. My wife has had a pair for a while and they are much more comfortable to wear. We just ordered 2 more of them from Amazon. They are easier on the ears.

author: Anne Johnson
title: Really good headphones for non-music use
content:
I use these quite a few times a week listening to phone calls in a call center. For that purpose, these are great. The sound is rich, and I find the headphones comfortable - however, I am not wearing them more than 10 minutes at a time.

There are things to note about this. First, they are compact, and could be good for travel (they don't leave my area, so I can't speak from experience). If you do use them this way, they are not something you could throw in with heavy things and forget. They do need to babied a little to not break - which might pose a problem for people traveling. Also, I have noted the "shorting" other reviews mention. I do not think this is a short. I have seen repeatedly where my plug seems to be falling out of the jack easily - once fixed, the sound is fine. I think the plugs might have a very slight size issue, Despite this, I would absolutely recommend these to anyone.

author: BB
title: I can't believe how long these headphones have lasted! Especially how much I put them through.
content:
First, I was NOT paid for this review and did NOT receive the product for free.

I can't believe how long these headphones have lasted....especially for being what most people consider "cheap" ones!

 I usually blow through headphones really fast.....even the good ones. It's always just one side that goes out which is why I decided to just go with ones that don't cost so much. It's been almost a year now and they still work.

author: A. K.
title: They don't sound amazing, but pretty good for on-ear
content:
These are inexpensive. They don't sound amazing, but pretty good for on-ear, foam cover headphones. They allow you to hear the outside world when you go walking in the street.

Mine last about six months with very heavy use and jogging 10 miles a week with all the stress and jostling and sweat this creates. The foam pads do not get lost or torn excessively easily and are not the first thing to go. Usually it's the driver or the chord wire connection that gives out first.

I have had eight of these in the last three years and highly recommend them.

author: Kathleen Watson
title: Didn't work right on 1st use - waste of money!
content: I purchased these for my daughter to use with her iPod while walking the dog.  I was not expecting great sound for the price, BUT I did expect them to work properly.  However, on the FIRST use, she says the sound was not working right in one ear. It says they were marked down from $19.95, so I especially expected them to be decent.  I'd return them, but not worth the postage. I'm disappointed with Panasonic.

author: y3n
title: Warning!!! May not work if you have a hard / hybrid case on your phone or tablet
content:
In terms of comfort, these headphones are "ok". The padding is a little thin / weak, so it feels slightly uncomfortable, but it's not terrible given the price.

However, the biggest issue (and the reason I plan on returning it) is the fact that I cannot plug it into my Samsung Galaxy Pro 8.4 with a hybrid / hard case. The plug molding is too big (and the right angle probably doesn't help either) and cannot plug all the way into the socket with the hybrid case. I have 2 different hybrid / hard cases, and this does not work with either of them.

This *may* work for some / soft cases, but to be safe, I would rather buy a pair of headphones with a slimmer (and straight) headphone plug.

author: Emily S
title: You get a bit better than what you pay for (7 bucks)
content: Decent quality considering the price. You get a bit better than what you pay for (7 bucks), but what do you really expect at such a low price? The sound is alright. Not great--maybe too much bass? Not very crisp or clear sound, but not the worst. Unfortunately, I can't use them because my head is too small (they're too big on the smallest setting) and no matter what I do to make them fit, they don't sit on my ears properly. Maybe I'll give them to a friend or something, or just keep them for "emergency."

author: Buyer
title: Great Cheapo Headphones!
content: Our company bought 4 pairs of these for our customers to view a video with music.  They hang on a nail behind a couch where they can sit and watch.
